plants.name: Peashooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>How can a single plant grow and shoot so many peas so quickly? Peashooter says, "Hard work, commitment, and a healthy, well-balanced breakfast of sunlight and high-fiber carbon dioxide make it all possible."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Peashooters are your first line of defense. They shoot peas at attacking zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000>Single lane</color></size>

plants.name: Sunflower
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sunflower can't resist bouncing to the beat. Which beat is that? Why, the life-giving jazzy rhythm of the Earth itself, thumping at a frequency only Sunflower can hear.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sunflowers are essential for you to produce extra sun. Try planting as many as you can!

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>First production is 5~8 Seconds after planting.</color></size>

plants.name: Cherry Bomb
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I wanna explode," says Cherry #1. "No, let's detonate instead!" says his brother, Cherry #2. After intense consultation, they agree to explodonate.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherry Bombs can blow up all zombies in an area. They have a short fuse so plant them near zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000>3×3 (A circle with a radius of 1.375 tiles)</color></size>

plants.name: Wall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"People wonder how I feel about getting constantly chewed on by zombies," says Wall-nut. "What they don't realize is that with my limited senses, all I can feel is a kind of tingling, like a relaxing back rub."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Wall-nuts have hard shells which protect your other plants.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Wall-nut and subsequent fusions prevent splash damage from explosive cherries at difficulty 4 or lower. </color></size>

plants.name: Potato Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Some folks say Potato Mine is lazy, that he leaves everything to the last minute. Potato Mine says nothing. He's too busy thinking about his investment strategy.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Potato Mines pack a powerful punch, but they need a while to arm themselves. You should plant them ahead of zombies. They will explode on contact.

<color=black>Arming Time: </color><color=#8B0000>15~17 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000>Single tile (A circle with a radius of 0.68 tiles)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles). </color></size>

plants.name: Chomper
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Chomper almost got a gig doing stunts for "The Little Shop of Horrors" but it fell through when his agent demanded too much on the front end. Chomper's not resentful, though. He says it's just part of the business.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Chompers can devour a zombie whole, but they are vulnerable while chewing.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill
<color=black>Chewing Time: </color><color=#8B0000>30 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals 40 damage each bite to zombies that are immune to being devoured.</color></size>

plants.name: Puff-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I only recently became aware of the existence of zombies," says Puff-shroom. "Like many fungi, I'd just assumed they were fairy tales or movie monsters. This whole experience has been a huge eye-opener for me."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Puff-shrooms are cheap, but can only fire a short distance.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000>2.5 tiles ahead</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Can stack up to three times in a single tile.
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).</color>
<color=black>Spreading: </color><color=#8B0000>Plant Fume-shroom or Scaredy-shroom on 1/2/3 Puff-shrooms to spread it ahead/in a fan shape, spawning 1/3/6 Puff-shrooms.</color></size>

plants.name: Fume-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I was in a dead-end job producing yeast spores for a bakery," says Fume-shroom. "Then Puff-shroom, bless 'im, told me about this great opportunity blasting zombies. Now I really feel like I'm making a difference."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fume-shrooms shoot fumes that can pass through screen doors.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000>4 tiles ahead</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Has infinite pierce, ignores handheld armor (Type 2).
<color=black>•</color> Puff-shroom spreader.</color></size>

plants.name: Hypno-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Zombies are our friends," asserts Hypno-shroom. "They're badly misunderstood creatures who play a valuable role in our ecology. We can and should do more to bring them round to our way of thinking."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>When eaten, Hypno-shrooms will make a zombie turn around and fight for you.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Makes a single zombie fight for you.</color></size>

plants.name: Scaredy-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Who's there?" whispers Scaredy-shroom, voice barely audible. "Go away. I don't want to see anybody. Unless it's the man from the circus."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Scaredy-shrooms are long-ranged shooters that hide when enemies get near them.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000>Single lane</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gets scared and stops attacking when there are zombies in the 3×3 surrounding area.
<color=black>•</color> Puff-shroom spreader.</color></size>

plants.name: Ice-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Ice-shroom frowns, not because he's unhappy or because he disapproves, but because of a childhood injury that left his facial nerves paralyzed.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Ice-shrooms temporarily immobilize all zombies on the screen.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Freezes all zombies in place for 4 seconds, inflicts Chill for 10 seconds and deals 20 damage to all non-flying zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Doom-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"You're lucky I'm on your side," says Doom-shroom. "I could destroy everything you hold dear. It wouldn't be hard."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Doom-shrooms destroy everything in a large area and leave a crater that can't be planted on.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000>5×5 (A circle with a radius of 3.75 tiles)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>After explosion, leaves a crater that lasts for 180 seconds. Does not leave crater when planted on water.</color></size>

plants.name: Lily Pad
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Lily Pad never complains. Lily Pad never wants to know what's going on. Put a plant on top of Lily Pad, he won't say a thing. Does he have startling opinions or shocking secrets? Nobody knows. Lily Pad keeps it all inside.</color></size>
plants.info: Lily Pads let you plant non-aquatic plants on top of them. Special: Non-aquatic plants can be planted on it. When specific plants are placed, Lily Pad transforms into a variant of it that can automatically plant the plant that transformed it every 90 seconds. Variants: Sunflower, Threepeater, Squash, Torchwood, Jalapeno.

plants.name: Squash
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm ready!" yells Squash. "Let's do it! Put me in! There's nobody better! I'm your guy! C'mon! Whaddya waiting for? I need this!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Squashes will smash the first zombie that gets close to it.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Squashed zombies do not trigger their on-death effects.</color></size>

plants.name: Threepeater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Threepeater likes reading, backgammon, and long periods of immobility in the park. Threepeater enjoys going to shows, particularly modern jazz. "I'm just looking for that special someone," he says. Threepeater's favorite number is 5.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Threepeaters shoot peas in three lanes.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Threepeater and subsequent fusions redirect projectiles that would be lost off-map on topmost/bottommost lanes to their own lane.</color></size>

plants.name: Tangle Kelp
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm totally invisible," Tangle Kelp thinks to himself. "I'll hide here just below the surface, and nobody will see me." His friends tell him they can see him perfectly well, but he'll never change.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Tangle Kelp are aquatic plants that pull the first zombie that nears them underwater.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles). </color></size>

plants.name: Jalapeno
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"NNNNNGGGGG...." Jalapeno says. He's not going to explode, not this time. But soon. Oh, so soon. It's close. He knows it; he can feel it; his whole life's been leading up to this moment.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Jalapenos destroy an entire row of zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000> Single lane</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Instantly eliminates Zombonis and their ice trails.</color></size>

plants.name: Spikeweed
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hockey is Spikeweed's obsession. He's got box seat season tickets. He keeps close track of his favorite players. And he consistently cleans up in the office hockey pool. Just one problem: he's terrified of pucks.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spikeweeds pop tires and hurt any zombies that step on them.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1 Second</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Does not block regular zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Instantly kills vehicles and disappears.</color></size>

plants.name: Torchwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Everybody likes and respects Torchwood. They like him for his integrity, for his steadfast friendship, for his ability to greatly maximize pea damage. But Torchwood has a secret: He can't read.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Torchwoods turn peas that pass through them into fireballs that deal twice as much damage.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Ignites peas that pass through it, damage +20. 
<color=black>•</color> Turns snow peas back into regular peas. 
<color=black>•</color> Dispels fog in a cross shape.</color></size>

plants.name: Sea-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sea-shroom has never seen the sea. It's in his name, he's heard loads about it, but he's just never found the time. One day, though, it'll go down.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sea-shrooms are aquatic plants that shoot short ranged spores.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000> 2.5 tiles ahead</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Returns 50 sun after fusions.</color></size>

plants.name: Plantern
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Plantern defies science. He just does. Other plants eat light and excrete oxygen; Plantern eats darkness and excretes light. Plantern's cagey about how he does it. "I'm not gonna say 'sorcery,' I wouldn't use the term 'dark forces,' I just... I think I've said enough."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Planterns light up an area to let you see through fog, and give Lumos levels to plants.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Dispels fog (5×7 except the corners). Plantern fusions dispel fog in a smaller cross shape.</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Provides 1 Lumos Level in a 3×3 Grid, which can be stacked to provide strength to other Lumos plants. Refer to its fusions for the list of affected plants.</color></size>

plants.name: Cactus
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>She's prickly, sure, but Cactus' spikes belie a spongy heart filled with love and goodwill. She just wants to hug and be hugged. Most folks can't hang with that, but Cactus doesn't mind. She's been seeing an armadillo for a while and it really seems to be working out.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cactuses shoot spikes that can hit both ground and air targets.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Prioritizes flying zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Blover
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>When Blover was five he got a shiny new birthday cake. Blover made his wish, huffed and puffed, but was able to extinguish only 60% of the candles. Instead of giving up, though, he's used that early defeat as a catalyst to push himself harder ever since.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Blovers blow away all balloon zombies and fog, except Bucket-copter Zombies and Zomppelins.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Blows away fog for 30 seconds and Balloon Zombies. Pushes back Zomppelins slightly.</color></size>

plants.name: Starfruit
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Aw, man," says Starfruit. "I went to the dentist the other day, and he said that I have four cavities. I've got—count it—ONE tooth! Four cavities in one tooth? How does this happen?"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Starfruits shoot stars in 5 directions.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×5/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Pumpkin had just wrapped up his part-time gig. "Honestly, it was a pretty fun experience," he chuckled. "But can someone explain why they kept stuffing candy and candles inside me?"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pumpkins protect plants that are within their shells.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Pumpkin and subsequent fusions prevent splash damage from explosive cherries at difficulty 4 or lower. </color>
<color=black>Fusion Priority: </color><color=#8B0000>Lowest, hold Left Shift key while fusing to forcibly fuse with Pumpkin. (with Better Pumpkin Fusions mod, included by default)</color></size>

plants.name: Magnet-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Everyone wondered why Magnet-shroom always took so long to "digest" the iron he absorbed, even after it had already been taken away for fusion. Frustrated, he snapped, "I'm not lazy! I just got knocked out by flying iron!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Magnet-shrooms can absorb metallic objects.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attracts metal objects within a radius of 3 tiles. Takes 15 seconds to process. Drops unprocessed objects on death or fusion.</color>
<color=black>If there is a magnetic plant in the 8-direction vicinity of another magnetic plant, they are then connected through the <color=#666699>Magnetic System</color>. The <color=#666699>Magnetic System</color> has no limit to its number of connections, and will boost the strength of some magnetic plants based on its amount. Refer to its fusions for the list of affected plants.</color></size>

plants.name: Cabbage-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Some say love is like a cabbage; you have to peel it layer by layer to see the other person's heart. But Cabbage-pult has some reservations about this, as he is still single himself.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches cabbages to attack zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000>Single lane</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Lobbed projectiles ignore handheld armor (Type 2).</color></size>

plants.name: Flower Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Plants always think Flower Pot is just a "pot," but in reality, Flower Pot is a "flower" that just looks like a "pot." Look, that little sprout is the bud of a flower.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Allows planting plants above it.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Enables plants to be planted on bare ground/roof.
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>Fusion Priority: </color><color=#8B0000>Lowest, hold Left Alt key while fusing to forcibly fuse with Flower Pot. (with Better Pot Fusions mod, included by default)</color>

plants.name: Kernel-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Plants are curious where Kernel-pult's butter comes from. Kernel-pult doesn't know either, but that doesn't stop him from making popcorn with it in his spare time to earn a little extra cash.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Throws corn kernels to attack zombies and can also throw butter to immobilize them.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000>Single lane</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 1/4 chance to throw butter, dealing 40 damage and immobilizing zombies for 4 seconds.<color=#8B0000></color>

plants.name: Garlic
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Garlic boasts of his high allicin content, claiming that eating garlic is good for health. Whether that's true or not, you only have to watch the zombies gagging as they chew on him to know it's pretty effective. </color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Any zombie that tries to bite him will switch lanes.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Zombies that bite him will change lanes. Receives no more than 15 damage each bite.
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Leaf
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once a renowned passer, Umbrella Leaf was a superstar in the 114th Plant-Zombie NBA. But as he aged, he discovered he was going bald.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Deflects incoming basketballs.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Protects plants from catapult projectiles and Bungees within a 3×3 area.
<color=black>•</color> Protects plants from explosive basketballs but each protection costs 100 Toughness.
<color=black>•</color> Stop Mecha-nut Zombies in their tracks.</color>

plants.name: Marigold
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Marigold is extraordinarily wealthy, so it spends freely—though technically, it doesn't even have hands or feet.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces Silver Coins, Gold Coins, and Diamonds.

<color=black>Production Interval: </color><color=#8B0000>25 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Coin Amount:
</color><color=#8B0000><color=black>•</color> 75% Chance = 100 Coins
<color=black>•</color> 20% Chance = 300 Coins
<color=black>•</color> 5% Chance = 1000 Coins</color>

plants.name: Melon-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>During breaks, Melon-pult loves to split its melon arm into two, nibbling away to cool off. "Want a taste?" it asks the zombies cheerfully, while the plants around, sweltering in the heat, can only drool enviously.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches melons at zombies to deal damage.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000>Single lane</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Melons deal splash damage in a 1-tile radius with falloff, calculated as bullet damage ×8 /(number of zombies hit), capped at 1/3 of the projectile's base damage.</color>

plants.name: Saw-me-not
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>For plants, spinning petals without damaging their stems is a skillful art. Some botanists speculate that Saw-me-not might be distantly related to Blover because of this ability. "It's indeed a tricky skill," Saw-me-not said with a faux-profound air, "The real challenge lies in obtaining lightweight circular saws and painting them with petal patterns."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Damages zombies in close range with his spinning sawblades!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>8/0.02 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 5 points of Shield every 0.5s, up to 300 max.
<color=black>•</color> Spins blades when zombies get close, dealing piercing damage that scales down with more targets, to a minimum of 1.</color>
<color=black>Shield Mechanic: </color><color=#8B0000>Shields provide a 20% damage reduction to protected plants. Defensive plants gain crush immunity when shield is above 400.</color>

plants.name: Electronion
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Electronion thought his moment had come — after all, who else had eaten lightning over a hundred times? Surely, he was destined to play the Frankenstein monster! But when he received the script, his dreams short-circuited. He wasn't a star. He wasn't even a sidekick. He was just Dr. Stanley's lightning rod...</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attack approaching zombies with lightning rays!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>100/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Attack Range: </color><color=#8B0000>5×5</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> When another attacking Electronion is in range and is idle, it will recharge, providing an additional 150 damage for this shot.
<color=black>•</color> Each hit can connect to other zombies to deal half the damage, up to a maximum of 3 zombies.</color>

plants.name: Firnace
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Firnace won the sixth annual “Plant Helper” award of the Snowy Plains. Fellow plants agreed the honor was well deserved—after all, he’s so busy keeping others warm, he hasn’t even had time to clear the snow off his own head.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A floating firwood heater that helps nearby plants resist the cold.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Hovering plant. Protects plants in its own tile from Snowballs and Blizzards.
<color=black>•</color> Deals 200 damage every 3 seconds to ice blocks within its protection range.
<color=black>•</color> Absorbs the base Snow plant below it to temporarily evolve into Hi-temp Firnace, expanding its protection range to 3×3 for (1.2 × Plant Cost) seconds before reverting. Otherwise lasts 180 seconds by default.
<color=#cceaed>Snow Map Gimmick</color>:
<color=black>•</color> Ice blocks have 2000 HP and block straight-firing projectiles and zombies.
<color=black>•</color> If destroyed by plants, spawns the corresponding plants.
<color=black>•</color> If spawns the corresponding zombotany instead; if none exists, spawns an Snowmaw.
<color=black>•</color> A blizzard starts at the beginning of every wave, freezing all unprotected plants into ice blocks.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Sharpshooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spruce Sharpshooter just moved to the snowy plains. His pursed lips make him look fierce and hard to approach. But Firnace isn't scared—he knows that expression is just from his new friend pulling up his collar because the snowfield is just that cold.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cold-resistant archer that fires piercing spruce needles.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles pierce once (including ice blocks) and ignore handheld armor (Type 2).</color>

plants.name: Snow Lotus
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Snow Lotus never planned to become a healer—but when your mere presence makes nearby plants feel better, word spreads fast. Now she spends her days reluctantly running a clinic, insisting, “I’m just cold, not qualified.” Patients don’t seem to care.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cold-loving healer that gains energy in the cold to heal nearby plants.

<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1 ice charge every 10 seconds or when hit by a snowball or snow trident.
<color=black>•</color> Consumes 5 charges to awaken and heal all plants in a 3×3 area for 50 HP every 3 seconds.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>

plants.name: Aloe Aqua
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Aloe Aqua thought opening a spa in the snowy plains would be relaxing—until she realized no one wants a cold soak in subzero weather. At least the snow keeps the towels crisp.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cold-loving lobber that throws dew drops, or ice chunks when it's sufficiently chill.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>100/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom respectively.
<color=black>•</color> Consumes 1 charge to throw an ice chunk (×2 damage, applies Deep Chill, 40 Cryo points).
<color=black>•</color> Deep Chill: same as regular chill but affects Frost Legionnaires too. Zombonis are still immune.
<color=black>•</color> Deals ×4 damage to frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs.</color>

plants.name: Doubleblast Passionfruit
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Doubleblast Passionfruit only fires one shot at a time, so what’s the "double blast"? Ah, it’s the sound of zombie bones cracking.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Floating passionfruit that fires seeds at enemies.

<color=blue>SHUTTLE Collab Plant</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Hovering plant.
<color=black>•</color> Each hit deals an extra damage equal to 10% of the zombie's max Toughness to the zombie's headgear armor (Type 1).
<color=black><color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 3000 Coins. Cooldown: 2 seconds. Launches a giant passionfruit seed that deals 40 damage and shrinks the targeted zombie's size and HP to 70%.</color>

plants.name: Pearmafrost
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I fell from a pear tree, and I've been here a long time," says Pearmafrost. "Too bad there were no genius brains under the tree. But at least I can ponder physics myself." When will he take a break? That depends on when brainless zombies interrupt him.
plants.info:
<size=36>Releases shockwaves when bitten, dealing damage and applying Chill.

<color=blue>SHUTTLE Collab Plant</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000> 4000</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>When bitten, releases a small shockwave every 3 seconds, dealing 20 damage and applying Chill, adding 35 Cryo points.</color>

plants.name: Icetip Lily
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Though he often shouts "Off with their heads!", Icetip Lily isn't a warmonger. As the master of Snowy Mountain martial arts, his ice-morphs-to-blade technique can deter any impure intruder.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Each attack releases 5 ice blades in a fan shape.

<color=blue>SHUTTLE Collab Plant</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×5/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color>Blades pierce twice, apply Chill, add 5 Cryo points, and deal ×4 damage to frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks only when there are zombies in its own row.

plants.name: Chrysanctum
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Chrysanctum loves the snowy plains—every second here is rewarding and joyful. After all, he'd never seen snow before.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Grants nearby plants temporary invincibility.

<color=blue>PvZ: Ultimate Collab Plant</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
Disappears 2 seconds after planting. Grants all plants in a 3×3 area 6 seconds of immunity to all damage and crushing.</color>

plants.name: Grave Buster
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Despite Grave Buster's fearsome appearance, he wants everyone to know that he loves kittens and spends his off hours volunteering at a local zombie rehabilitation center. "It's just the right thing to do," he says.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Plant Grave Busters on graves to remove the graves.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Plant Grave Buster on a gravestone to remove it, taking 5 seconds. Drops itself as a seedpacket if not planted on a grave.</color>

plants.name: Obsidian Barley
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Obsidian Barley statue in the garden is rumored to be the result of a plants' building game gone rogue. "Who knows," says Obsidian Barley with a chuckle. "I think they saw me as the ultimate 'Build & Guess' challenge long before I arrived. But hey, I don't mind — who wouldn't want more chances to show off their looks?"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A sleek, obsidian-like version of Barley that periodically transforms into a random Ultimate plant.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Conditions: Replaces Barley in Odyssey: Adventure</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Transforms into a random Ultimate plant every 30 seconds (excluding Avarice-shroom)</color>

plants.name: Coldsnap Bean
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The plants couldn't figure out how such a tiny bean could chill the air so effectively. But Coldsnap Bean just grinned mischievously. "You know why Cattail sneezes when she washes clothes? Because she washes 'cat' clothes." Maybe the real magic was in its sense of humor.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hey↑ Yeh↓！

<color=#4A2900>Unlock Conditions: Complete Wall-nut Billards 1</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Hovering plant.
<color=black>•</color> Strengthens the snow pea shooters below to launch polar ice peas, increasing the damage and Cryo points inflicted on the zombie by 2 times.</color>

plants.name: Queen Endoflame
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The once-fiery little flower has grown into a master of sunlight production after enduring hardships. Queen Endoflame no longer needs to get hurt to shine. The torch on her head has become her power, blazing like the sun. The shining flames keep passing on, creating one Endoflame after another.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Blasts zombies to dusts with solar flares.

<color=blue>PvZ: Cricket Fight S6 Collab Plant</color>
<color=#4A2900>Usage Conditions: Odyssey Mode</color>
<color=#4A2900>Unlock Conditions: Clear Odyssey Classic</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>50×8/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Increases damage by 25 for each unique type of Odyssey Plant on the field.
<color=black>•</color> Targets zombies across the screen (prioritizes flying zombies).
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles return 5 sun on hit and can be upgraded by passing through Squashed Infernowoods for x4 damage and the ability to return 25 sun each (with the increased sun value Odyssey Modifier, return 15 and 50 sun instead).<color=#8B0000></color>

plants.name: Burger Blaster
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Plants often wonder about Burger Blaster's origins, especially when they see him stacking other plants on him to enhance his power. In truth, he's just a byproduct of Dave's attempt to make a taco out of plants. "Actual product may vary. Additional fillings are self-provided."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Assemble the burger as instructed by the labels!

<color=blue>PvZ: Hybrid Edition Collab Plant</color>
<color=#4A2900>Unlock Conditions: Beat Vasebreaker - Chain Reaction</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000> Tall plant. Fires random projectiles. Upgrades by using Cactus, Melon-pult, and Winter Melon to reach the highest level. Go to the next page for info on the upgrades.<color=black>

|</color> Cactus Upgrade <color=black>|</color> Level: 0 → 1
<color=black>•</color> Toughness: 1000 → 2000
<color=black>•</color> Attack Interval: 3 → 2.5
<color=black>•</color> Num. of Shots: 2 → 4
<color=black>•</color> New Projectiles: Spike, Butter, Squash

<color=black>|</color> Melon-pult Upgrade <color=black>|</color> Level: 1 → 2
<color=black>•</color> Toughness: 2000 → 3000
<color=black>•</color> Attack Damage: 30 → 40
<color=black>•</color> Num. of Shots: 4 → 6
<color=black>•</color> New Projectiles: Hot Melon, Melon

<color=black>|</color> Winter Melon Upgrade <color=black>|</color> Level: 2 → 3
<color=black>•</color> Toughness: 3000 → 4000
<color=black>•</color> Attack Interval: 2.5 → 2
<color=black>•</color> Num. of Shots: 6 → 8
<color=black>•</color> New Projectiles: Winter Melon, Snow Pea, Snow Spore, Doomspike<color=#8B0000></color>

plants.name: Jicamagic
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm a grand magician to rival the great Imitater," proclaimed Jicamagic. However, only his good friend, Imitater, knows the truth: Jicamagic and Dr. Edgar used to study life sciences in the same class.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Catalyst for Titan fusions.

<color=#4A2900>Unlock Conditions: Beat any Titan fusion level in Fusion Showcase</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>A fusion catalyst for Titan plants. Place it on the middle plant to start the fusion. Titan fusions are indicated with "∞".<color=#8B0000></color>

plants.name: Imitater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I remember the Zombie Wars back in 76", says Imitater in a raspy, old-man's voice. "Back then, we didn't have all these fancy peashooters and jalapenos. All we had was guts. Guts and a spoon."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Imitater can make copies of your plants!

<color=#4A2900>Unlock Conditions: Beat Odyssey Gacha - Imitater</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Plant Imitater on a plant or fusion to receive a free seed packet of that plant.
<color=black>•</color> Cannot imitate pots, pads, pumpkins or drones. 
<color=black>•</color> Failure returns an Imitator seedpacket.</color>

plants.name: Neko Squash
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The grace of a cat and the clumsiness of a squash make a unique kind of beauty," Neko Squashmurmurs."Once I master both, I'll stir things up on this lawn. She adjusts her hat and locks eyes on an unsuspecting zombie nearby."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Super Nyanko, Neko Squash!

<color=#4A2900>Unlock Conditions: Beat Squash Showdown</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Drops itself if it doesn't hit anything. For each zombie crushed, a Squash seed packet is dropped, up to a maximum of 3. Crushing 3 or more zombies will drop an additional Spicy Squash seed packet. This does not trigger in water lanes.</color>

plants.name: Swordmaster Starfruit</size>
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I have fought across 3,000 miles of battlefield, my blade halting millions in their tracks." The Swordmaster Starfruit, a lover of fine drinks and poetry, takes great pride in his impeccable cosplaying skills. With a sly smile, he adds, "My sword never bleeds, for it is merely a decoration."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>A guest from afar, I think you will want to become friends.

<color=#4A2900>Unlock Conditions: Beat The Gods 1</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>(200×5+30×20)/6 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack unleashes 5 swords that pierce infinitely, dealing 200 damage each. Additionally, it inflicts 600 damage to all zombies within the surrounding grid, repeating this 20 times.</color></size>

plants.name: Zombie Giftbox
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Introducing the Zombie Giftbox—the zombies' entry point into the world of finance. As a high-risk financial product, it comes equipped with a reminder: "Investing carries inherent risks; proceed with caution. Sponsored by Dr. Yan Wang." This vital information is cleverly tucked inside the box lid.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Earn 100 Sun, but spawns a Gold-box Zombie.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Grants 100 sun, but spawns a Golden Mystery-box Zombie. (Conehead/Buckethead Ducky Tube Zombie in water lanes)</color></size>

plants.name: Solar Giant-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Twin Solar-nut asked me to do him a favor for 500 Sun, so I came. How difficult can it be? It can't be rushing into a pile of zombies... right...? It's not, right!?</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Crushes zombies by rolling on them like a bowling ball.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>600/0.02 Seconds</color></size>
plants.cost: <size=36>Spawned when Twin Solar-nut is clicked when there's sufficient Sun.

plants.name: Cattail Girl
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Cats are usually afraid of water, but I'm a magical cat girl, so I'm not afraid," she said enthusiastically, and the other cats looked at her with admiration. Actually, she absolutely loves water, and she said this to make herself stand out.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>The Cattail Girl will automatically attack all zombies that appear on the map. Prioritizes flying zombies.

<color=blue>P"Girls"vZ Collab Plant</color>
<color=#4A2900>Unlock Conditions: Beat Attack On Gargantuar!</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×2/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Barley
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Barley calls itself a generalist, but other plants think of it as just a bit player — "After all, other plants always do the work, don't they?"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Barley regularly transforms into other plants.

<color=#4A2900>Unlock Conditions: Beat I, Zombie without clicking Start Fight</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Transforms into a random non-Odyssey fusion (or upgrade) plant every 30 seconds. Transformation stops after further manual fusion.</color></size>

plants.name: Endoflame
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>It is said that small flowers like her would never dream of producing Sun — the Endoflame was originally going to apply for the position of Sunflower, but she realized that her light would only shine when she is being destroyed. Everyone says that the flame at the top of her head is the brightest, but she knows that her fiery eyes of determination are the source of her strength.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Endoflame can absorb projectiles and produce Sun.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1200</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each projectile reduces Toughness by 200 and produce 25 Sun. Produces a Fertilizer upon death.</color></size>

plants.name: Giant-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I am invincible on the battlefield, and my partners can't take their eyes off my majestic figure!" the Giant-nut boasted. "One year after getting kicked out of the Wall-nut Tumbler Club, I finally found a job that truly suits me."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Giant-nut rolls forward, knocking down all zombies in its path.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>600/0.02 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Rolls down the lane, killing all the zombies on its path.</color></size>

plants.name: Plant Giftbox
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>No one quite understands why the Plant Giftbox fights alongside the plants against the zombies. He doesn't look like a plant at all, yet he seems to know every plant's abilities inside and out. "Actually, I'm just a college student who loves video games," he admits with a grin. "The professor mentioned extra credit, so here I am."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>The Plant Giftbox can be planted to produce random plants or fusions.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>When placed on soil or on a Lily Pad, produces a random plant. Placing it on top of an eligible plant can produce a random fusion.</color></size>

plants.name: Swordsage Starfruit
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The flowers in the hall intoxicate three thousand guests, and the sword frosts fourteen states." "I won't board the ship when the emperor calls me, and I say I am a fairy in wine." Swordsage Starfruit likes to recite poems and practice his drunken sword skills when he is drunk. The plants marveled at his power to defeat the zombies, but he said that he was aiming his flying sword at the bright moon in the sky, but when he put the sword away, it would fall back to the earth. </color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Swordsage Starfruit sweeps through enemies and summons ten giant swords descending from the sky.

<color=#3D1400>Usage conditions: Available only in Abyss Challenge, upgraded from Swordmaster Starfruit after beating Level 10. You can only have 1 Swordsage Starfruit on the lawn.</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>(1800×2+1800×10)/6 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>When attacking, deals 1800 Damage to zombies within a 3×3 area twice, then summons 10 giant swords that seek out enemies across the entire field, each dealing 1800 area damage upon landing.</color>

plants.name: Empress-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Empress-shroom holds great affection for her zombie subordinates. "They contributed significantly to my rise as an Empress," she expressed. Unfortunately, these powerful zombies instill fear in other plants, something Empress-shroom is completely unaware of.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Summons zombies that will fight for you.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Hypnotizes biters up to 5 times.
<color=black>•</color> Every 30 seconds, randomly selects 1 of the following zombies to summon:
Football-nut Zombie | Enraged Cherryshooter Newspaper Zombie | Zomboni | Scholar Zombie | Zombarine (water lane).
<color=black>•</color> Instantly summons a zombie when an Enchantress-shroom dies within a 3×3 range.
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Summon Interval → 10 Seconds | Enchantress-shroom Subspecies Unlocked
2. Can now summon corresponding Ultimate Zombies</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Cherrybomber
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm not sure why the Gatling Pea has so many fans. My brother and I can fire four bullets too," Gatling Cherrybomber remarked enviously. However, the truth is that everyone appreciates Gatling Pea for his kindness and outstanding culinary talents.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gatling Cherrybomber is the strongest damage-dealer on land.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300×4/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Related Odyssey Modifier: Squashed Infernowood Synergy</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> You need to have unlocked all the Odyssey Modifiers of Gatling Cherrybomber and Squashed Infernowood to obtain this synergy.
<color=black>•</color> Gatling Cherrybomber now fires equal amounts of projectiles across three lanes when attacking, with the upper and lower projectiles following sine and cosine trajectories. Squashed Infernowood unleashes Jalapeno effect across the entire field if there’s no available space to spawn a Spicy Squash.</color>

<color=black>Main Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Plants' explosive cherries ×3 damage
2. Attack Interval → 0.75 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Squashed Infernowood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Squashed Infernowood has a high opinion of himself, but other plants regard him with disdain, particularly those in the pea family. "He's too picky! He possesses such strong power, yet it only benefits cherries," they say. This infuriates Squashed Infernowood. "I'm just allergic to peas…"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spawns a Spicy Squash for every 20 projectiles that get converted after passing through.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Inherits Infernowood's traits, but does not burn zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Cherry bomb bullets that pass through it become bouncing spicy squashes that explode after every bounce.
<color=black>•</color> For every 21 projectiles ignited, spawns a Spicy Squash in front.
<color=black>Related Odyssey Modifier: Gatling Cherrybomber Synergy</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> You need to have unlocked all the Odyssey Modifiers of Gatling Cherrybomber and Squashed Infernowood to obtain this synergy.
<color=black>•</color>Gatling Cherrybomber now fires equal amounts of projectiles across three lanes when attacking, with the upper and lower projectiles following sine and cosine trajectories. Squashed Infernowood unleashes Jalapeno effect across the entire field if there’s no available space to spawn a Spicy Squash.</color>

<color=black>Main Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Projetiles required for Spicy Squash → 11
2. When there's no space to produce a Spicy Squash, directly ignite the lane instead</color></size>

plants.name: Cherrizilla
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cherrizilla proudly says, "Many envy my dinosaur-like hairstyle." As a public figure, he's mindful of his image: "Spitting cherries and eating zombies is gross, but it's my duty."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherrizilla is the ultimate defensive plant on land.

<color=#4A2900><color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color></color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1000/1.75 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color>Invincibility: Once every 30s, survives a fatal hit with 1 HP remaining for 5 seconds.
<color=black>•</color>Ultimate: Chomping zombies restores 1000 Toughness, deals 1000 damage, and turns their parts into exploding cherries which Cherrizilla spits back to deal additional damage.
<color=black>•</color> Once every 40s, performs an ultimate move that instantly kills a non-miniboss zombie whose HP is less than [current Cherrizilla HP + 500 × (number of past ultimate move count)], restoring 8000 HP back to Cherrizilla and refreshes the Invincibility ability.
<color=black>•</color> Tall plant. Repels vehicles and takes at most 1/3 maximum Toughness per hit.
<color=black>•</color> Excess Toughness drains at 800 per second, until it returns to 8000.</color>
<color=black>Related Odyssey Modifier: Obsidian Tall-nut Synergy</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> You need to have unlocked all the Odyssey Modifiers of Cherrizilla and Obsidian Tall-nut to obtain this synergy.
<color=black>•</color> When Cherrizilla and Obsidian Tall-nut are both present, Cherrizilla's attack deals AoE damage and no longer has a maximum Toughness cap, and Obsidian Tall-Nut gains a 90% damage reduction.</color>

<color=black>Main Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Heal amount ×3
2. Invincibility time increased to 10 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Doominator-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Would Death employ a fashionista? Doominator-shroom had no idea, but after noticing that he couldn't consistently frighten zombies, he turned to Hypno-shroom for some costume suggestions. Although people might not favor Death, how would they react if he wore sparkling ice wings?</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Doominator-shroom deals immense damage, simultaneously hypnotizing and slowing down zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>150/0.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each hit adds 20 Cryo points.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Has a chance to turn zombies with Toughness < 50% into hypnotized Frost Tall-nut Sentinels.
<color=black>•</color> Creates an explosion in the grid where the hypnotized zombie is located, dealing 450 damage.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Doominator-shroom attack speed 3x; Thornminator attack damage x3
2. Zombies take a 30% max HP damage every time they become defrozen</color></size>

plants.name: Twin Solar-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Twin Solar-nut, a photosynthesis master, revolutionized light energy-mass conversion, minimizing energy loss through recycling. He humbly credits the pioneers: "I'm just standing on the shoulders of giants."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Twin Solar-nut produces Sun every time it is injured.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Regardless of the damage type, each damage it receives will reduce a set 50 Toughness. Produces 15 Sun after every such hit.
<color=black>•</color> Clicking on it consumes 500 Sun, causing a Solar Giant-nut to come rolling down and restoring Toughness to full.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. The cost of spawning a Giant Solar-nut is reduced to 200 Sun
2. Toughness reduced per hit → 10</color></size>

plants.name: Spikesidian
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After being baptized by fire and ice, Spikesidian became as hard as steel, but its temperament also became erratic. This change is likely due to the steel that condensed in its mouth, making it reluctant to speak.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spikesidian can deal immense damage while also tanking multiple tires.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300×2/1 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Possesses the characteristics of Spikerock. Recovers 500 Toughness every 15 seconds.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Damage multiplied by 5 | Obsidian Spike-nut Subspecies Unlocked
2. Gains a 95% Damage Reduction</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Doom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Gatling Doom is dangerous and should not be approached. It is a forbidden force in the world." Despite the frightening tales circulating among the plants, Gatling Doom is not as it seems. In fact, it is one of the friendliest plants. However, the zombies turned to ashes would disagree.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Destruction incarnate. Fires rounds of destruction unlucky enough to face its wrath.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300×4/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Fires a bullet of doom that deals 1800 damage once every 4 round of bullets. Each bullet will splash damage over a large area. Rests for 4.5 seconds after the bullet of doom is shot.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. No more rest between every attack | Gatling Frenzy-shroom Subspecies Unlocked
2. Can now fire bullets of doom every round</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Icicle-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The little puff-shrooms who once shouted, "We are going to join the army!" have matured into veterans with resolute eyes. Wherever and whenever, the Gatling Icicle-shroom Company is committed to ensuring that the mission is accomplished.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can be stacked three times to shoot 12 icicles at once!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×4×3/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each hit adds 5 Cryo points. Icicles deal 4 times more damage to frozen enemies. Each icicle can pierce 2 times.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Increased penetration to infinite times
2. Increased damage to Frozen zombies by 10x | Gatling Sunburst-shroom Subspecies Unlocked</color></size>

plants.name: Magnetar
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>No one knows where Magnetar is from, but one thing's for sure: He was not responsible for the dinosaurs. Not at all!</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Why the heck is there a meteor on my lawn!?

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30×5/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>+20 Damage per Lumos Level.</color>
<color=#666699>Magnetic System: </color><color=#8B0000>+5% Damage per Magnetic Plant.
Both systems can increase the damage of the stars by upto 300, maximum.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Summons a meteor every 15 seconds, dealing 1800 damage upon impact. Splits into multiple stars that home in on zombies and deal 100 damage each. Inherits aircraft-downing ability from Magnethorn.</color></color>
<color=black>Related Odyssey Modifier: Helios Cabbage Synergy</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> You need to have unlocked all the Odyssey Modifiers of Magnetar and Helios Cabbage to obtain this synergy.
<color=black>•</color> When there are at least 10 Magnetars and 10 Helios Cabbages on the field, the Magnetar will summon the Helios Meteor instead, while Helios' summoned Mini Sun will not disappear and will also continue to summon ordinary Meteors.
<color=black>•</color> Helios Meteor: Deals damage equal to (1800 + 1800 x Amount of Magnetars) x (1 + 0.2 x Amount of Helios Cabbages), and drops 1250 Sun.</color>

<color=black>Main Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Attack Interval → 0.5 Seconds
2. Base damage is doubled and limiter (120) is removed</color></size>

plants.name: Oblivion-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Nuclear deterrence is beneficial. Someday, the zombies will stop their assaults out of fear of my formidable self-detonation," Oblivion-shroom asserted with confidence. Yet, it was evident that Oblivion-shroom failed to understand that zombies wouldn't initiate a Cold War just because they were hit with cold air.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sprays deadly fumes all around, bringing ultimate destruction. Beware!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>(100+100×8)×4/1.9 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Damage Range: </color><color=#8B0000>5×5</color>
<color=black>Detection Range: </color><color=#8B0000>5×3</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack adds 5 Cryo points.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Sprays spores, which then explode (both deal penetrating damage). An explosion occurs upon death, dealing damage and freezing all zombies on the screen.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Damage on death → 1,000,000
2. Now absorbs explosion damage. When 10,000 damage is absorbed, a Doom-shroom explosion is released</color></size>

plants.name: Laser Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Magnet-shroom's power remains unmatched," said Laser Pumpkin. "After all, composite armor, electromagnetic catapults, and plasma guns came nearly a century after aircraft carriers." Other plants envied Laser Pumpkin's high-tech gear, but only Magnet-shroom knew his power came from a Magnetar meteorite.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spawns laser drones that home in on enemies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>16000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Always has a Laser Drone wingman with him when he appears. Generates a Laser Drone on top of a tile around a 3×3 area regularly. 
<color=#666699>Magnetic System:</color> When part of a Magnetic System with a Mechanized Pumpkin or any Metal-upgraded Pumpkin, gains their special traits. Additionally, assimilates one Mechanized Pumpkin in the same system into a Laser Pumpkin every 30 seconds until there is only one Mechanized Pumpkin.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Wingmen Amount → 3
2. All drones damage ×3</color></size>

plants.name: Laser Drone
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Thanks to Laser Pumpkin, now we have an entire arsenal of hi-tech equipment! Take a look at these beauties: Composite alloy armor, electromagnetic rotor, and plasma railgun... Wait, NO!!! THAT WAS MY FAVORITE VASE!!!</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Laser Drones shoot piercing lasers to attack.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>200/1.5 Seconds (Stationary)
200/1 Seconds (Wingman)</color></size>

plants.name: Obsidian Tall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Rather than seeking his best friend's protection, this plant prefers to protect him. With a hard, gem-like body and steadfast gaze, he's forged by the Obsidian Tall-nut's soul, enduring trials of ice and fire. Though his body may wear down one day, he's determined to keep other plants safe.</color></size></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>The Obsidian Tall-nut has four times the defense of a normal Tall-Nut.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>32000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Restores 1500 Toughness every 15 seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Tall plant. Resists being run over by a car, taking a maximum of 200 damage each time.
<color=black>•</color> When one Obsidian Tall-nut receives damage, it is shared and divided among all Obsidian Tall-nuts on the lawn.
<color=black>•</color> Blocks Balloon Zombies from passing, forcing them into the ground.</color>
<color=black>Related Odyssey Modifier: Cherrizilla Synergy</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> You need to have unlocked all the Odyssey Modifiers of Cherrizilla and Obsidian Tall-nut to obtain this synergy.
<color=black>•</color> When Cherrizilla and Obsidian Tall-nut are both present, Cherrizilla's attack deals AoE damage and no longer has a maximum Toughness cap, and Obsidian Tall-Nut gains a 90% damage reduction.</color>

<color=black>Main Odyssey Modifiers:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Recovers 10,000 Toughness when affected by Ice-shrooms. Full Toughness if Jalapeno
2. Redirects damage dealt to adjacent plants in the same lane to itself</color></size>

plants.name: Wither-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After overcoming past struggles, Wither-pult now aims for a calm life. "All I want now is to watch classic movies and live in peace."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Capable of rapid, spread-fire volleys of projectiles.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120/2 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>42% chance of rapid-firing. Has an equal chance to spread-fire in a number equal to the number of zombies in its lane. Projectiles split into garlic cabbage, garlic kernel (25% garlic butter), and garlic melon upon impact.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Spread-fire is now guaranteed
2. Gains inherent Melon Pot's traits</color>

plants.name: Cob-livion Cannon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Clad in icy armor and dark as a warning, each shot from Cob-livion Cannon brings destruction. Zombies hit by it need not prepare—nothing will remain after the flash.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Possesses earth-shattering power.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Main Blast - 1800 in a 3×3 area. 
<color=black>•</color> Additional 1800 + 30% of Zombies' maximum Toughness across the entire screen.
<color=black>•</color> Side Gun: 360×2/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Arming Time: </color><color=#8B0000>36 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Infuses all plants within the main blast area with Ice-shroom (prioritized)/Doom-shroom. 
<color=black>•</color> Side cannon inflicts Chill and adds 10 Cryo points.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Main Blast damage ×4
2. Reload Time → 12 Seconds</color>

plants.name: Midas Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>From its appearance, you can tell that Midas Umbrella has a knack for business. "That's right, my hat of emerald was a trade item I exchanged with someone from a place full of blocks..."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A combination of Alchemist Umbrella and Umbrella Kale.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Has the traits of both its ingredients.
<color=black>•</color> Also allows projectiles to hit zombies in the two rows below.
<color=black>•</color> Its Coffee Bean ultimate can instantly kill zombies below 50% Toughness.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:<color=#8B0000>1. Projectiles will continuously bounce along other Midas Umbrellas until the last one without cap. Each bounce increases projectile damage by 125% instead of 75%.
2. Activates ultimate automatically free of charge if zombies are near. 7.5 seconds cooldown | Aegis Umbrella Subspecies Unlocked</color>

plants.name: Enchantress-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The subjects of the Empress-shroom are captivated by the Enchantress-shroom's mysterious power. "She's not just my advisor; she's the force that keeps our kingdom thriving. Her magic isn't just powerful—it's explosive", the Empress-shroom declared. In truth, the Enchantress-shroom simply delights in blowing up any unruly dissenters who dare resist her charm.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Summons exclusively explosive zombies to fight for you!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Empress-shroom's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> The same as Empress-shroom, but only summons Gatling Cherry Newspaper/Gatling Explod-o-rider zombies. Use Hypno-shroom and Cherry Bomb to switch between the two.
<color=black>•</color> Benefits from Empress-shroom modifiers.
<color=black>•</color> Immediately summons when an Empress-shroom dies in a 3×3 range, Empress-shroom too when a nearby Enchantress-shroom dies.</color>

plants.name: Ashen Threepeater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The flames consume his broken body, each breath a torment, yet the Ashen Threepeater stands tall. He believes the fire within will achieve eternal glory in one final, grand explosion.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Ashen Threepeater awaits his rebirth.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Loses attack capabilities after being thoroughly burnt.</color>

plants.name: Phoenix Threepeater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>No one knows if fire truly brings rebirth to plants—it's just a legend. Those who chased it turned to ash, until he became the new legend. "I don't know how many times I must endure the flames to succeed, but for them, I have to."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>From fire reborn!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>160×3/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Ignites the whole lawn upon entry.
<color=black>•</color> Its bullets inflict the Enflamed debuff and pierce 2 times.
<color=black>•</color> Its damage is doubled after passing through a Squashed Infernowood.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Enflamed damage multiplier → 150%, and regular ignited peas can now inflict the debuff
2. Bullets can now pierce infinitely</color>

plants.name: Gravitron
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Gravitron has mastered electromagnetism with Magnetar. "It's not rocket science—left-hand force, right-hand electricity", it boasted. "And don't forget the moving magnet—trust the smartest plant around!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gravitron pulls stars, accelerates them and launches at zombies at maximum force.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Magnetar</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Magnetar. Use Starfruit and Blover to switch between the two.
<color=black>•</color> Storage Limit - 60 | Acceleration Time - 1.5 Seconds | Damage ×3 | Projectile Speed ×2</color>

plants.name: Garlizilla
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Dressed in plain clothes with a gaudy gold tooth, one word from him sends others fleeing. "Garlick me, I've had enough of the spotlight. Standing out doesn't suit me anymore—I just want a quiet, simple life."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cousin to the ultimate defensive plant on land.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Cherrizilla</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1000/1.75 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Cherrizilla. Use Cherry Bomb and Garlic to switch between the two.
<color=black>•</color> No longer heals from cherry explosions, inherits garlic properties, and shoots projectiles that poison zombies.</color>

plants.name: Blast Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cherry? Pumpkin? Or a hybrid born of fusion? The Blast Pumpkin doesn't bother with such details. For him, Halloween is all about handing out juicy cherries to the good kids and cherry bombs to the naughty ones—nothing else matters. </color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Blast-proof pumpkin.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Laser Pumpkin</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>16000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Laser Pumpkin. Use Cactus and Cherry Bomb to switch between the two. No longer spawns Laser Drones or assimilates Mechanized Pumpkins, instead spawns self-destructing drones every 30 seconds that seek out zombies and explode like a Cherry Bomb.
<color=black>•</color> Absorbs the damage from cherry explosions to heal from them.</color>

plants.name: Aegis Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Many question the relationship between Midas Umbrella and Aegis Umbrella. "We're brothers!" Aegis confidently declares, thumping its canopy. "My dear elder brother is just going through a rough patch emotionally."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Reflects projectiles from zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Midas Umbrella's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Midas Umbrella. Use Cabbage-pult and Melon-pult to switch between the two.
<color=black>•</color> Loses the ability to buff lobbed projectiles and attract tridents. Instead, gain 90% Damage Reduction and the ability to reflect bullets from zombies.</color></color>

plants.name: Charmatron-shroom
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>With the power of love and friendship, even a rotting zombie with an unbeating heart would become our best friend and greatest ally! Well, that and a copious amount of suspicious mind-altering spores powered by magnets of all things that are <b>DEFINITELY<b> safe for human contact. Well, for now at least...
- TetsuDaPlanta (@tetsuchris)</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Charisma maxima.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/2 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles have a 1-tile splash radius with no falloff.
<color=black>•</color> Zombies cannot consume it and are hypnotized instead.
<color=black>•</color> Feeding it metal objects grants 1 charge level for 30 seconds, up to 2 charges.
<color=black>•</color> At charge level 1, it fires 2 shots per attack. At charge Level 2, 4 shots.
<color=#666699>Magnetic System:</color> Each plant in the same Magnetic System provides a 5% damage boost to its shots.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Hypnotization Toughness threshold increased from 50% to 100%
2. Now always in a fully-charged state | Attack Interval → 1 Second</color>

plants.name: Obsidian-mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Obsidian-mine possesses immense power despite its size. He fears no zombies. However, it has its troubles, as block people with diamond pickaxes often come to knock on its head.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Has extremely high Toughness and can block Diggers.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Obsidian Tall-nut</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>32000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Obsidian Tall-nut. You can use Potato Mine and Tall-nut to switch between the two.
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Blocks Digger Zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Releases a small potato explosion for every 1000 damage received (before damage reduction), dealing 500 damage to zombies in a small area.<size=36>

plants.name: Magicat Nettle
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I think it's better to use animal hair to keep myself above water than relying on, for example, a swim ring!" Magicat Nettle stands by her belief. Hmm... If you think this is due to her poor academic skills and inability to stay afloat on the river, you're right. How could a cat possibly swim! Though she refuses to be categorized randomly.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Summons drones to attack every time she defeats a zombie.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>160×2/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Summons a drone every time a zombie killed. The drone fires 30 nettle spikes that deal 100 damage each.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Basic Attack Damage ×5.
2. Drone Attack Damage ×3.</color><size=36>

plants.name: Titan Apeacalypse Minigun
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Titan Apeacalypse Minigun rarely interacts with people. It's not due to arrogance, but because people keep asking whether the fire on his body is hot or cold, and whether he can create hot ice or cold fire. These questions bore him.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Becomes stronger the more Toughness it loses.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120×3/0.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Each shot fired inflict 50 self-damage until Toughness is reduced to 1500. 
<color=black>•</color> Shots knockback zombies and pierce twice, with power halved per pierce. 
<color=black>•</color> Fires faster as Toughness decreases and reaches maximum speed of 0.25 seconds at 1/3 Toughness. If Toughness is further reduced, attack damage increases. Damage is capped at 480 at 0 Toughness.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Defense increases as Toughness decreases. Below 100 Toughness, it becomes immune to damage under 100.
2. Increases projectile damage and knockback ×3.</color><size=36>

plants.name: Calamity-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Everyone wonders how Calamity-shroom subdues massive creatures to serve her. Endless destruction should bring silence... When questioned, she sits alone atop a tower, sipping her dreamy brew: "Oblivion? No, I simply grant them rebirth within illusions."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Turn the tide of battle!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Hypnotizes zombies in range (same as Doom-shroom) and makes them explode upon death, dealing damage like Doom-shroom.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:
<color=#8B0000>1. Doom-shroom explosions now leave no craters | Avarice-shroom Subspecies Unlocked
2. Summons 3 hypnotized Armored Gargantuars upon explosion. Each hypnotized zombie summons a Zomboni too.</color><size=36>

plants.name: Gatling Sunburst-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Production is also part of the fight!" said Gatling Sunburst-shroom, wiping its sweat. Its platoon has been reorganized into the 'Sunshine Bay Construction Corps,' but their fighting spirit remains undiminished.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates a large amount of sun for you.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Gatling Icicle-shroom's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×4×3/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Gatling Icicle-shroom. You can switch between the two with Ice-shroom or Sunflower.
<color=black>•</color> Shots no longer slow but instead drop 5 sun on hitting the 1st and 2nd zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Each subsequent pierce deals 20 more damage but requires 5 sun per hit (does not consume Sun if the total amount of Sun is below 15k).
<color=black>•</color> Synergizes with the sun value doubling Odyssey Modifier and dropped suns are worth 15 each when the modifier is active.</color><size=36>

plants.name: Gatling Frenzy-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Compared to the composed demeanor of Gatling Doom, Gatling Frenzy-shroom has a much shorter temper, especially when someone calls her a "Gray Egg". She often yells "Quietus!" and charges into the fray.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Continuously fires Doom-shroom attacks at zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Gatling Doom's Modifier.</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/1.5 Seconds (0.25 Minimum)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Gatling Doom. You can use Peashooter and Scaredy-shroom to switch between the two.
<color=black>•</color> Each attack will shorten the attack interval by 0.1 seconds, to a minimum of 0.25 seconds. Explodes when zombies get near.
<color=black>•</color> Fires a bullet of doom every 16 attacks, dealing 1800 damage. When the "fires bullets of doom every round" Odyssey Modifier is active, fires a bullet of doom every 4 attacks.</color><size=36>

plants.name: Obsidian Spike-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Obsidian Spike-nut loves hugs. "A warm embrace can soothe even the rowdiest of zombies," he says. And sure enough, every zombie he's hugged is now lying peacefully on the lawn... completely still.
plants.info:
<size=36>Defends against zombies and vehicles with its spikes.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Spikesidian's Modifier.</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>16000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Use Spike Rock and Wall-nut to switch between Spikesidian and Obsidian Spike-nut. 
<color=black>•</color> Reflects any damage received back to the zombie that inflicted it.
<color=black>•</color> Received damage is capped at 1000.
<color=black>•</color> Recovers 1500 Toughness per 15 Seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Can puncture tires, dealing 50% of the maximum Toughness to the vehicle zombie and repelling them.
<color=black>•</color> Benefits from Spikesidian's Odyssey Modifiers.</color>

plants.name: Tycoon Torch
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Though still a small child, Tycoon Torch returned from abroad with a showman's flair. His "turn a stone into gold" trick had audiences roaring with delight. Backstage, as he stirred a mysterious drink, he smirked and whispered, "It's kind of magic, actually."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Turn all straight-shooting bullets into coin bullets!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Convert all ordinary straight-shooting bullets encountered into 2 Silver Coins and 1 Gold Coin.
