<color=black>•</color> Gold Coins will move in a straight line. Silver Coins will split to the top and bottom rows initially then join the Gold Coins in the middle row after 0.8 Seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Silver Coins will deal 100% of the original bullet's damage.
<color=black>•</color> Gold Coins will deal 200% of the original bullet's damage.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. 2% Damage increase to Tycoon Torched bullets for every 1000 Coins you have
2. Tycoon Torch's projectiles now deal splash damage</color>

plants.name: Thornminator
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Thornminator is one of the top hairstylists in town, revolutionizing botanical fashion with every masterpiece she crafts. "Real style takes real work," she says, twirling a carving knife between her fingers. Hammers and chisels may not be traditional hairstyling tools, but for her, they're essential for "fixing" even the most stubborn strands.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires Doom-Hypno Ice Spikes. When planted, unleashes a barrage of Doom-Hypno Ice Spikes.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Doominator-shroom</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each frozen pea inflicts chill and adds 20 Cryo points. Deals ×4 damage to frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Doominator-shroom, use Fume-shroom and Cactus to switch between the two. 
<color=black>•</color> Attacks pierce infinitely, prioritizes air units.
<color=black>•</color> Has a chance to hypnotize zombies and cause explosive damage—same effect as Doominator-shroom.
<color=black>•</color> When planted, scatter-shoots at least 60 Doom-Hypno Ice Spikes, targeting both air and ground enemies.</color>

plants.name: Helios Cabbage
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Sun God—lord of light and warmth, the eternal ruler of the heavens. Wherever he treads, darkness withers, and life flourishes under his radiant embrace. Suspended high above the firmament, his indomitable glow pierces the void, casting away despair and igniting hope in all who bask in his presence. His light is eternal, his will unshakable—the beacon that guides the world forward.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Summons a Mini Sun to attack zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300×5/2 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Summons a Mini Sun every 30 seconds. The Mini Sun lasts for 15 seconds and deals 30+(30×Amount of Helios Cabbages) damage to all zombies every 0.5 seconds.
<color=black>•</color> When the total amount of Sun is higher than 15k, consume 250 Sun to inflict double the damage each time the Mini Sun damages zombies.
<color=black>•</color> When the Mini Sun is present, the drop rate of Sun in the level is greatly increased, the damage of ordinary meteors is buffed by 20, and an additional 250 Sun is dropped when they land.</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 1000 Coins; if there is no Mini Sun on the field, summon it immediately. Otherwise, extend the duration of the Mini Sun by 15 seconds. Only one Mini Sun can exist at a time.</color>
<color=black>Related Odyssey Modifier: Magnetar Synergy</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> You need to have unlocked all the Odyssey Modifiers of Magnetar and Helios Cabbage to obtain this synergy.
<color=black>•</color> When there are at least 10 Magnetars and 10 Helios Cabbages on the field, the Magnetar will summon the Helios Meteor instead, while Helios' summoned Mini Sun will not disappear and will also continue to summon ordinary Meteors.
<color=black>•</color> Helios Meteor: Deals damage equal to (1800+1800×Amount of Magnetars) x (1+0.2×Amount of Helios Cabbages), and drops 1250 Sun.</color>

<color=black>Main Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Its projectiles gain the effect of Solar-pult's projectiles
2. Its summoned Mini Sun will deal ×3 more damage</color>

plants.name: Mechanized Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After a full-scale mechanical overhaul, Mechanized Pumpkin was a fortress on wheels. Composite armor? Check. Iron reinforcements? Double check. Tactical interface? You bet. Everything was perfect... until he caught a glimpse of his reflection. A crab. They turned him into a crab. "Guys, seriously?! A little heads-up would've been nice!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A pumpkin with many functions.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color>
<color=#8B0000>Metal Plant. Has a multitude of traits.
<color=black>•</color> Immune to Jack-in-the-Box explosions.
<color=black>•</color> Allows Digger Zombies to come out of the ground early.
<color=black>•</color> Halves damage from Cherry explosions.
<color=black>•</color> Allows you to use Iron objects to regain Toughness.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers: </color><color=#8B0000>To Be Determined</color>

plants.name: Radiant Pot
plants.introduce: Deep in the garden, where the sun always shines, Radiant Pot stands in quiet devotion. He doesn't chatter, nor does he boast—he simply gives, weaving sunlight into golden coins, waiting patiently for you to grow as radiant as he is.
plants.info:
<size=36>Can quickly generate a lot of Sun and Coins.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits traits from Golden Pot. Produces 50 Sun and 100 Coins every n=(Current Sun/1000) Seconds, where 3 ≥ n ≥ 15.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Upgrade costs from Silver Pots to Golden Pots will not exceed 8000
2. Coins exceeding the maximum amount will be converted into Sun at a rate of 2:1</color>

plants.name: Pharos Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once the beloved director of the Plant Orphanage, she was more than just a caretaker—she was family. Her broad leaves were the perfect playground for young sprouts, offering shade, comfort, and joy. Though those days have passed, her kindness remains. "Oh? Would you like to try this marshmallow, my boy?" she asks, her warmth as enduring as ever.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots lasers to attack zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300</color>
<color=black>Energy Limit: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Search Range: </color><color=#8B0000>(2×Lumos Level+1) Rows</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> It has all the traits of Lumos Umbrella.
<color=black>•</color> Fires lasers to attack zombies, dealing 100% damage every second. Prioritizes zombies in the sky, and deals ×3 damage to air targets. Can attack up to 4 zombies at a time.
<color=black>•</color> When there are injured plants within a 3×3 range, Energy will be consumed to heal the plants. Each treatment consumes 200 Energy Points and restores 20% of its maximum Toughness, not exceeding 2000.
<color=black>•</color> When two Pharos Umbrellas are positioned one above and one below, they will link together, and their detection range will expand to cover the entire screen. In this state, the two Pharos Umbrellas can simultaneously attack up to 6 zombies, and their damage is doubled. Additionally, if exactly 6 zombies are being attacked, a 3×3 explosion will occur at the location of a random zombie every 6 seconds, dealing 300% of the attack power as damage.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Energy Limit ×10 | Recovery Speed ×20 | Healing Speed ×2
2. Normal Attack Multiplier → 300% | Explosion Multiplier → 1000% | Attack Interval → 2 Seconds</color>

plants.name: Avarice-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"They told her not to open it. Naturally, she opened it."Avarice-shroom ran a finger along the ornate lid, gilded and humming faintly with temptation. Whispers spilled from within—hunger, envy, ambition—all begging to be set free. With a smile too knowing to be innocent, she lifted the seal. What emerged wasn't hope. It was profit. "Welcome, little monster," she whispered, as the abyss stirred and a new fortune clawed its way out.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>She can summon Mini-boss zombies!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Calamity-shroom's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Calamity-shroom. Use a Doom-shroom and Marigold to switch between the two.
<color=black>•</color> Summons a Mini-boss Zombie after it spawns, depending on the scene:
Day: Professor Cherryz | Night: Giga Football Striker | Pool: Jackson Worldwide | Fog: Skystrider Mecha | Roof 1: Pozeidon | Roof 2: Clown Jill-in-the-Box | Roof 3: Ultra Mecha-nut
<color=black>•</color> At the same time, summons its ordinary Odyssey variant on all rows.
<color=black>•</color> Defeating the Mini-boss Zombie gives you a ton of Sun, Coins, and points.
<color=black>•</color> Defeating an ordinary Odyssey variant gives you 1 Plant Giftbox.
<color=black>•</color> It can only be summoned once per round. This plant will not spawn from a Plant Giftbox.</color>

plants.name: Cherrybomber Drone
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Originally developed as a rapid-fire prototype for the Gatling Cherrybomber, Cherrybomber Drone was recently upgraded to fire real cherry rounds to combat the zombie surge—earning explosive acclaim.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Provides enhanced firepower when coordinated with shooter plants directly below.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Gatling Cherrybomber</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300×2 /1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Hovering plant and Subspecies of Gatling Cherrybomber. Use the Shovel and Blover to switch between the two.
<color=black>•</color> If there is a straight-shooting plant directly below, its attack CD synchronizes with that plant’s (up to 2 seconds).
<color=black>•</color> Maximum number of Cherrybomber Drones on the lawn: (number of lanes×2)</color>

plants.name: Napalm-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Napalm-Shroom isn’t just fire on the battlefield—his BBQ skills are legendary. His dream? To host the greatest barbecue party ever, with every plant and zombie in town invited.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs Napalm melons that split on impact and leave behind an inferno.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>3000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/7.5 Seconds + 30/0.02 Seconds (Inferno)</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Each melon creates an inferno zone that lasts for 2.5 seconds.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Range: 4 tiles. After launching a Napalm melon, rests for 1.5 seconds, then charges up for at least 6 seconds, increasing damage to 1+(charge time in seconds×50%).
<color=black>•</color> Attacks pierce all armor and split into 2 additional Napalm melons that target nearby zombies with the same damage.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Attack range extends to the entire lane ahead
2. Inferno zone duration doubled</color>

plants.name: Krakerbillion
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Taste the fury o' the briny deep, ye scurvy dogs!" Since sailin' back from Davy Jones' Locker, Krakerbillion be a changed beast—fiercer, greedier, and twice as hearted. With treasure plundered from the seven seas and a fire in his vines, he rules the water lanes like a true sea devil. Any zombie tryin' to sneak in from the waves best be ready to walk the plank… 'cause this matey fights with both hearts and no mercy!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Greedy overlord of the seven seas, capable of squeezing every last drop of value from zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×3/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Retains all traits of Krakerberus, but can drag zombies underwater an infinite amout of times (up to once per second).
<color=black>•</color> Zombies hit by its projectiles turn golden—when they die, they grant ×3 Odyssey points. Max bonus: +2000 points per wave.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Gain +5% attack damage for every 1000 points owned (up to +400%)
2. The Odyssey shop now has a 30% discount on Modifiers.</color>

plants.name: Buck-shroom Squad
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Buck-shrooms' worst fear finally came true—they really did get stuck to a Magnet-shroom, and no one's been able to pull them off. But maybe it’s a blessing in disguise. With all the materials the Magnet-shroom collected, they've upgraded their gear and become a true "Steel Battalion."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A multi-purpose squad skilled in rapid fire, anti-air, and sniping!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>6000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80×4/1 Second (Machine gun); 240/2 Seconds (Flak cannon); 400/3 Seconds (Sniper)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant. 
<color=black>•</color> Machine gun rounds knock back targets and deal additional damage based on the current HP of their Type 2 armor.
<color=black>•</color> The flak cannon targets only air units in its lane, dealing knockback and same-tile splash damage.
<color=black>•</color> The sniper attack shares the same traits as Sniper Pea.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Sniper damage increased to 1,000,000, with a 1/3 chance to trigger rapid-fire snipes, but attack interval increased to 7.5 Seconds
2. Knockback distance and flak cannon splash damage ×3</color>

plants.name: Quantum McCornics
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>He was born at the dawn of the universe, his age beyond reckoning. From the primordial void, he plucked three stars to orbit him as moons—treasures not even black holes could steal. Now, the old one finds joy in toying with this cosmic keepsake, as ancient as he is.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hurls ultra-dense black holes that collapses into an explosion, releasing all the absorbed energy.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/2 Seconds (Mini Butter)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant.
<color=black>•</color> 75% chance to launch Mini Butter, shrinking non-miniboss zombies' size and HP to 70%. If shrinking fails, the target is stunned for 1.5s. Instantly kills imp-class zombies.
<color=black>•</color> 25% chance to launch an Ultimate Black Hole that lasts 2 seconds, slows nearby zombies, and absorbs Quantum McCornics' projectiles in a 3×3 area.
<color=black>•</color> Each bullet absorbed adds 2 seconds to its duration, up to 7.5 seconds. When it vanishes, it triggers a large explosion (Cherry Bomb-sized) that deals stored damage. If it lasted over 5 seconds, the explosion radius significantly increases.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Ultimate Black Hole can absorb all projectiles
2. Greatly increases the Ultimate Black Hole's absorption radius</color>

plants.name: Pea Sunflower
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Actually, the Sunflower behind me is my sister," Peashooter explained to everyone. "We've been inseparable since birth. She loves producing Sun, and I destroy zombies on her behalf." But everyone knows the truth: the cheerful Pea brother is a total siscon. After all, every zombie that gets near his sister mysteriously ends up vaporized by sunlight.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pea Sunflower can fire Sun Bullets which produce Sun.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Bullets has a 30% chance to drop 5 Sun when hitting zombies.</size>

plants.name: Cherryshooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"You think I have red-hot anger issues? Me? Bah! You're red and hot! Your whole family is red!" Cherryshooter despised being teased about the color of his head. But the jokes didn't last long. It was just a happy incident. After eating special cherries, Peashooter found himself turning red and hot, and surprisingly, he could shoot cherries.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherryshooter fires powerful cherries.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Solar Bomb
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"So… it's obvious… we are Pretty Cure, aren't we?" The two Sunflower sisters tried to suppress their excitement. "The world needs us to save it!" Their passion bubbled over as they shouted together, "Flash!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Solar Bomb can produce Sun after killing zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces 25 Sun for each zombie killed in the explosion.</color></size>

plants.name: Cherry-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I heard some zombies grumbling about their inability to eat cherries. Well, here I am!" The cheerful Cherry-nut shook the leaves atop his head, boasting about his pure cherry flavor. "But first, you have to promise me something: when you have cherries, share a bit with me. In fact, just give me everything you've got! I was born for this!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherry-nut can absorb explosion damage and restore Toughness.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Absorbs Cherry explosion damage to restore Toughness. (From Explosive Cherry: 200, From Cherry Bomb: 1000)</color></size>

plants.name: Pea-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"No... don't call me ugly, or else... wait... I'll spray you." Pea-nut has always struggled with his "unique" appearance. But he firmly believes that what's inside a plant matters more than how it looks. Seeking guidance, he humbly asked senior Bowling Nut for advice and eventually mastered the technique of rolling nuts like bowling balls.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pea-nut fires mini-nuts that can penetrate zombies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds (Piercing) </color>

plants.name: Explod-o-shooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Meet Explod-o-shooter, the ultimate plant killer. He's more irritable than ever—who would've thought the warm and friendly Cherryshooter would swallowanother special cherry? Don't push your luck with him. That cherry stuck in his throat might just be his next shot—his face is already turning red!</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots out cherries that explode on impact.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Its bullets will deal area explosion damage.
<color=black>•</color> Has immunity to cherry explosions.
<color=black>•</color> Reduces the Recharge of the last Cherry Bomb seed packet used for its fusion by 85%.</color></size>

plants.name: Solar-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Solar-nut always sees himself as an angel, blissfully unaware that the other plants often talk behind his back. "You know, if he adds a few black lines, he'd look exactly like a bee!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Solar-nut produces Sun while protecting your plants.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Damage Phases: </color><color=#8B0000>1333/2666</color>
<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/15 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces 25 Sun when entering into the next damage phase. Drops 50 Sun on death.</color>

plants.name: Pea Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Pea Mine may not have eyes, but he has his own special way of sensing zombies. "I feel it…" he murmured, "The zombies are getting closer… closer… closer…" Pea Mine's heartbeat quickened, and so did his firing speed. Faster, faster… until, with a "bang," Pea Mine exploded into a burst of potato-flavored fireworks.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pea Mine can attack before unearthing.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Fusion returns 50 Sun.
<color=black>•</color> Attacks faster as zombies get closer, with a minimum attack interval of 0.5 seconds. Upon exploding, deals 1800 damage to zombies in a small radius and releases 36 projectiles in all directions..</color></size>

plants.name: Cherrypeater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cherrypeater lives by the motto "good things come in pairs." Whether it's fighting zombies or handing out presents, he does it all in twos. "But come on," Repeater teased, "those cherries of yours aren't even close to ripe."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherrypeater can fire two cherries at a time.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×2/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Solar Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Stop at red lights, slow down at yellow lights, and obey traffic rules!" Solar Mine frequently warns zombies. But to the zombies, all they see is the disgusting green hue before them. He clutches his green leaves and pouts, wishing for more sunshine. "After all, sunshine is what fuels us all!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Solar Mine produces Sun until and after its explosion.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/15 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Fusion returns 25 Sun.
<color=black>•</color> Drops 50 Sun on explosion</color></size>

plants.name: Mine-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once seen as small and weak, Mine-nut now stood tall and strong, boasting a pair of big eyes and firm flesh. Yet beneath that sturdy exterior, he felt fragile and feared shrinking back to his former size. The zombies quipped, "If you take another bite, you'll explode!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Mine-nut can explode while being eaten and once when broken.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Damage Phases: </color><color=#8B0000>1333/2666</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>500/Phase Transition, 1800/Death</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant. Causes single-tiled explosions on damage phase transitions.</color></size>

plants.name: Chomp-shooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Chomper has always envied Chomp-shooter's ability to spit out zombie remains, and he's tried to learn the trick more than once. Little did he know, though, that the secret wasn't a special skill—it was just that Chomp-shooter's mouth was slightly deformed, causing bits of zombie to leak out while chewing.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Chomp-shooter can fire parts after biting.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Instant Kill; 80/3 Seconds (Zombie part)</color>
<color=black>Chewing Time: </color><color=#8B0000>30 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Spits out rolling zombie parts while chewing that deal 80 damage each and have Infinite pierce.</color></size>

plants.name: Chomp-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As a young plant, Chomp-nut was notoriously picky about food, never swallowing zombies in one bite, which frustrated its parents. After much persuasion, Chomp-nut finally learned to consume zombies whole, just like its predecessors. "I'm not picky! I just want to imitate how zombies eat. I should try something new, right? It's definitely not because I don't have a neck!" Chomp-nut said while chewing on a zombie.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Chomp-nut can restore Toughness after eating zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill</color>
<color=black>Chewing Time: </color><color=#8B0000>40 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Restores 1000 Toughness after digestion.</color></size>

plants.name: Chompzilla
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Chompzilla savors every meal, despite his smaller mouth. "Chompers are sloppy and don't hit the gym; they fall apart on the front line," he scoffs. "I only eat the essence of zombie meat and spit out the rest," he grins, though his backyard is filling up with leftovers.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Both a bulwark and fierce attacker.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> 200/1.75 (Chomp); 80/3 Seconds (Zombie part)</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Chomping zombies restores 200 Toughness and deals 200 Damage. Spits out rolling zombie parts after that deal 80 damage and pierce infinitely.
<color=black>•</color> Instantly kills unarmored zombies with less than 500 Toughness, restoring 400 Toughness. Also spits out parts that knockback zombies. 
<color=black>•</color> Every 40 seconds, the next bite deals 1M damage and restores to max (up to 16k HP). Excess Toughness drains at 200 per second.
<color=black>•</color> Damage taken per hit is capped at 1/3 Toughness.</color></size>

plants.name: Solar Chomper
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Everyone was curious about how Solar Chomper transformed the zombies it devoured into sunlight, but it always hesitated to share its secret. One day, Sunflower discovered that her Plant Food content had significantly diminished, revealing the truth: it wasn't actually turning zombies into sunlight.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Solar Chomper can produce Sun after swallowing zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill</color>
<color=black>Chewing Time: </color><color=#8B0000>40 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces 100 Sun after swallowing a zombie.</color></size>

plants.name: Chomp-mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Delicious and enticing, Potato Mines taste just like self-heating mashed potatoes, earning rave reviews from zombies. Among them, fries take the top spot in popularity. As zombies flock to the tantalizing aroma of French fries, they have no idea they're also indulging in tasty potato chips. "Just wait and see," Chomp-mine said with a mouthful, "Their nutrients will soon become new mines."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>After swallowing a zombie, the Chomp-mine will grow Potato Mines in front.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill</color>
<color=black>Chewing Time: </color><color=#8B0000>20 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Fusion returns 75 Sun.
<color=black>•</color> Plants a Potato Mine in front of it upon swallowing a zombie.</color></size>

plants.name: Cherry Chomper
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Ever since her drink with Cherry Bomb, Chomper has been constantly "buzzing." She turned into an absolute menace every meal. The sound of chewing transformed into explosive pops as plates and bowls flew everywhere, leaving everyone unwilling to dine with her. After a show of hands, Cherry Chomper ended up eating in the yard… at least she no longer has to buy new tableware.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces a cherry explosion upon eating a zombie.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill + 1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Chewing Time: </color><color=#8B0000>40 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Creates a 3×3 Cherry explosion in the tile directly ahead on successful biting.</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Cherry
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Gatling Cherry's barrel was always red hot. He assured everyone that it was preheated to ensure faster firing. Everyone bought the story—until they caught him eating special cherries without even removing the barrel.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherryshooter's final form!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×4/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Pea-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Don't let my size fool you; even a small body can contain a lot of energy," Pea-shroom cautions those who underestimate him. "We all began as tiny mushrooms, making progress a little at a time. With dedication to a sunny breakfast, you can become just like me."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pea-shroom shoots further than Puff-shroom.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/2.25 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Repeat-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Who am I? The double-shot holds the answer!" exclaims the little Repeat-shroom, proudly flaunting the twin leaves atop its head. With double the firing rate and double the cheer, these spirited beings thrive in groups, eagerly pouring their firepower onto the battlefield, showcasing that size doesn't define their strength.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Repeat-shroom can fire two small peas at a time.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/2.25 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Buckshooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I carry my ancestors' spirit—I won't fall here!" Buckshooter declared. When told his helmet looked like Buckethead Zombie's, he retorted, "Then let's invoke their will and ride again!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Buckshooter has the ability to crack armor.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant. Recovers 500 Toughness when fed metal object.
<color=black>•</color> Takes half the damage from explosive cherries.
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles knock back zombies and instantly break screen doors.</color></size>

plants.name: Nut-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Nut or mushroom? Why worry about labels? Nut-shroom isn't about to tell you it's actually a matsutake in disguise anyway.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Nut-shroom can be your stalwart defender despite its size.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color></size>

plants.name: Mini Hypno-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"As a kid, I believed zombies were nothing more than fairy tale monsters," Mini Hypno-shroom said softly. "Now, don't get it twisted—I'm just restoring them to the fairy tale form they were always supposed to have."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shrinks a zombie and makes it fight for you!

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Makes a zombie smaller (cuts Toughness to 70%) and fight for you.</color></size>

plants.name: Perfume-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The colorful Perfume-shroom makes a grand debut! With a blast of perfume, it can turn zombies around in an instant. Some claim it's a secret technique passed down by the mushroom family, while others believe it's a cutting-edge military weapon. Perfume-shroom just smiles and says, "It's all thanks to Hypno-shroom helping me rinse my mouth everyday."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Perfume-shroom sprays fumes that can hypnotize zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5 Seconds (Piercing) </color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Chance to hypnotize zombies with less than 50% Toughness. The lower the zombie's HP, the higher the chance, up to 25%.
<color=black>•</color> Hypnotization threshold is removed for zombies already hit by Trippy-shroom.</color></size>

plants.name: Trippy-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Scaredy-shroom has always been afraid of zombies. In order to reduce her fear, Hypno-shroom tells her a bedtime story every day: "Actually, there are good people among zombies." Over time, Scaredy-shroom was finally brainwashed. Now she can use spores to brainwash zombies. Of course, she is still very afraid.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Trippy-shroom can fire spores in 7 colors.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Randomly fires 1 of 7 types of spores. When a zombie is hit by all 7 types of spores, it will be hypnotized. Each time it is hit by a type of spore, the hypnotize probability of the Perfume-shroom will increase.</color></size>

plants.name: Gutsy-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Courage fills me, no fear remains~ Whether it's spring, fall, winter, or summer~" Gutsy-shroom no longer shrinks in the face of zombies. "I used to tremble, but Senior Fume-shroom told me, 'If a zombie gets near, spray your spores. Hiding won't solve anything.'"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gutsy-shroom is ready to take on the zombies, near or far!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30×2/1.5 Seconds (Long range); 30/1.5 Seconds (Short range, piercing)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Shoots 2 spores at once. When zombies get within 4 tiles in range, sprays piercing fumes instead.</color></size>

plants.name: Charm-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Charm-shroom speaks with a soft smile, "Each spore carries my love, and when they bloom, it's like a spring breeze caressing the air." She even twisted her head into a heart to express her feelings. Her eyes shine with sincerity, hoping that maybe, just maybe, the zombies will understand her love.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Charm-shroom can fire explosive Charm spores.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals 40 no-falloff splash damage in a cross shape. Has a chance to hypnotize zombies with < 60% Toughness (ignoring Type 2 armor).</color></size>

plants.name: Tall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The taller you are, the more powerful you become." Tall-nut firmly believed in this, which is why he always stayed on the front line. Other plants would urge him to take it easy, but he'd just smile and say, "It's fine, I'm tall. As long as you fight quickly, the zombies won't have time to eat all of me."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Tall-nuts are heavy-duty wall plants that can't be vaulted or jumped over.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Tall plant. Blocks Pole-vaulting Zombies, Dolphin Riders and Pogo Zombies. Cannot block Yeti Riders and charged Pogo jumps.</color></size>

plants.name: Football-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Football-nut looked fierce, causing some small plants that didn't know the truth to feel scared by his appearance. However, the plants that understood Football-nut knew that beneath his serious exterior lay a strong determination to protect his companions. The stolen helmet undoubtedly boosted his confidence.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Football-nut is able to hold a huge amount of damage.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>16000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant. Can be fed metal objects to restore 500 Toughness.
<color=black>•</color> Tall plant.</color></size>

plants.name: Buck-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Plants hold conflicting feelings about Buck-nut. As an exemplary soldier, he executes orders with unwavering precision, yet his cold demeanor leaves much to be desired. The rust at the corners of his mouth hints at a storied past. In the quiet moments, however, Buck-nut wrestles with an unspoken worry: "How do I prevent rust in a humid garden?"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Blocks the zombies' advance with a wall of iron.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Can be fed corresponding metal objects to restore 500 Toughness. This also applies to other Metal Plants. All metal plants receive half the damage from explosive cherries.</color></size>

plants.name: Repeater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Unlike his bright and cheerful brother, Repeater leads a carefree life—until it's time to fight. He secretly mastered the art of double shooting but kept it hidden from Peashooter. "I just want him to live happily, without ever needing to learn these battle skills."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Repeater fires two peas at a time.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Sun-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sun-shroom hates sun. He hates it so much that when it builds up in his system, he spits it out as fast as he can. He just won't abide it. To him, sun is crass.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sun-shrooms give small sun at first and normal sun later.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>15 → 25 / 25 Seconds
<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>120 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Gatling Pea, the big brother of the Pea family, stands tall with his gun barrel, the very foundation of everyone's safety. His back is like a monument on the battlefield, admired by all. Yet, he smiles modestly, knowing that his daily life is actually managed by his younger brother, Peashooter. "I can't live without him," he admits quietly.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gatling Pea shoots four peas at a time.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×4/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Twin Sunflower
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Twin Sunflower are known as sisters, always working behind the scenes rather than on the battlefield's front lines. Their role is to support everyone from the rear, but make no mistake—you must protect them. If they're harmed, many plants will quietly shed tears.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Twin Sunflowers give twice as much sun as a normal sunflower.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25×2/20 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Snow Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The cold-blooded Snow Pea rarely displays his emotions to other plants. Some say his heart is even colder than the frozen peas he fires. Snow Pea doesn't want to come off that way, but every time he opens his mouth, the bullets he launches plunge the atmosphere around him to freezing temperatures.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Snow Peas shoot frozen peas that damage and slow the enemy.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each frozen pea inflicts chill and adds 10 Cryo points. Deals ×4 damage to frozen zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Icicle-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Icicle-shrooms didn't set out to master refrigeration technology. During a hiking trip, they forgot their quilts and spent an entire night frozen atop a mountain, frost forming on their heads. Later, Snow Pea, captivated by their frosty appearance, gifted them some icicles to complement their new look.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Icicle-shroom fires icicles that slow down enemies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Inflicts chill and adds 5 Cryo points for every icicle hit. Pierce 2 times. Deals ×4 damage to frozen zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Mini Ice-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Smaller in size, same big abilities!" Mini Ice-shroom's signature poker face never cracks as he delivers his jokes, and that might just be why zombies freeze on the spot.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Mini Ice-shroom can temporarily freeze zombies they come into contact with.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Freezes zombies that eat it in place.</color></size>

plants.name: Frost-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Frost-shroom stands out among the Fume-shrooms. His study abroad in the freezing Alaskan wilderness made him even cooler—literally. Though he only studied hair design for a few years, he's pretty proud of it.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Frost-shroom's fumes can pass through and freeze zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5 Seconds (Piercing) </color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000> Attacks inflict chill and add 5 Cryo points.</color></size>

plants.name: Shivery-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Shivery-shroom believes he stands apart from other scaredy-shrooms. Unlike them, he never shrinks in fear and joins in all activities without hesitation. However, that's only because when he gets scared, the air around him plummets in temperature, leaving everyone too afraid to startle him.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shivery-shroom fires freezing spores.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks inflict chill, add 10 Cryo points and deal ×4 damage to frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Freeze nearby zombies when they get near.</color></size>

plants.name: Frost Tall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Frost Tall-nut raised its icy spikes high, ready to confront the zombies. Others remarked on how "cold" and "silent" he seemed. Yet, his expression remained unchanged, resolute in his defense against the undead. The truth was his face had simply frozen in place.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Tall-nuts with a minty taste. They slow down zombies that bite them.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies that bite it are chilled and accumulate 10 Cryo points.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Tall plant. When affected by the Ice-shroom, heals 1000 Toughness.</color></size>

plants.name: Cryodoom-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I will freeze the world, and silence will reign. The extreme cold will disrupt your body's temperature system, so it won't be very painful," Cryodoom-shroom proclaims. He seldom appears in battle, but when he does, a blizzard follows in his wake. With a flash of white light, even time seems to freeze.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cryodoom-shroom can destroy zombies in the entire screen and freeze time.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Freezes surviving zombies for 5 seconds. Also freezes the level temporarily – no new zombies will appear within 10 seconds.</color></size>

plants.name: Frostveil-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>A frosty beauty? An untouchable flower? Frostveil-shroom couldn't care less. She quietly took care of the frosty ornament on her head, always ready to hand her Frost Tall-nut headgear to the zombies at any time. "They'll appreciate the chill vibe," she remarks coolly.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>When a zombie eats a Frostveil-shroom, it will transform into a Frost Tall-nut Zombie that will fight for you.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Upon contact turns a zombie into a Frost Tall-nut Zombie that will fight for you. Also freezes the full field.</color></size>

plants.name: Frenzy-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>While some plants instinctively bury their heads when nervous, Frenzy-shroom thrives on excitement. His adrenaline spikes, causing his spores to fire at an increasing rate. It's wise to avoid provoking him again, or he might explode from all that pent-up energy.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Frenzy-shroom's attack speed increases as it attacks.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds (0.25 Minimum)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack will shorten the attack interval by 0.1 seconds, to a minimum of 0.25 seconds. Resets when zombies get near. Will explode when zombies get near while peak attack speed is reached.</color></size>

plants.name: Soot-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Soot-shroom, the misanthropic workaholic, can't stand the sight of zombies—too much of a distraction. He's got a small stash of bullets, but they're more than lethal enough. "Don't bother me unless it's urgent. If you want them dead, just shoot them yourself." Still, his sharp efficiency keeps everyone looking up to him.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Soot-shroom can destroy most zombies in front of it.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800/30 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Click manually to attack all zombies in a row.</color></size>

plants.name: Mini Doom-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Mini Doom-shroom may be small, but his temper is explosive. Disagree with him, and he might blow up—no eye contact needed. It's best to admire him from afar—just don't get too close, or things might get messy.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Mini Doom-shroom will explode when it comes into contact with a zombie.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Will explode when zombies get close.</color></size>

plants.name: Curse-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The plants have always wondered why zombies can't be killed for good. Recently, Curse-shroom uncovered the mystery: "I didn't really do much," it said modestly. "I just kindly helped the zombies activate their backup hidden power source. Doesn't that red zombie look especially harmless? I did warn them, though."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Zombies that eat the Curse-shroom will get hypnotized, and explode after death.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies that eat the Curse-shroom will be hypnotized and cursed. The cursed zombie will explode like a Doom-shroom upon death/leaving the lawn.</color></size>

plants.name: Doomspike-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Frost has wrapped around his body, stripping away the innocence of his youth. His eyes, colder and deadlier than any gun's barrel, now only show disdain for his enemies. He's become the reaper, the end of the line. Anyone caught in his frosty sights would do well to leave one less meal prepared at home.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Doomspike-shroom can fire explosive ice cones.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×4/3 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Add 10 Cryo points to zombies each hit. Deals ×4 damage to frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Pierces 2 times. Splashes for 10 damage without falloff within range of 1 tile.</color></size>

plants.name: Squash-spreader
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"He has three heads, and his base isn't even a leaf! He looks nothing like a regular pea!" Many plants cower at the sight of Squash-spreader's peculiar appearance. Yet, Squash-spreader remains unfazed. He thrives in his vibrant life, battling zombies, reading voraciously, playing chess, and winning every pool skipping contest.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Squash-spreader can fire small bouncing squashes.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×3/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Every time a mini-squash hits the ground, it inflicts 40 points of damage to nearby zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Spike-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spike-nut is always glaring, always frowning. "I need them to know I'm not a snack," he insists. The zombies, however, just laugh—because when has a Wall-nut ever been scary? Then they take a bite. Then they learn. The hard way.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spike-nut punctures the tires of approaching Zombonis!!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Reflects 1/2 of the bite damage inflicted on it back to the zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Punctures incoming tires in exchange for 500 Toughness. It cannot protect against submarines or being stomped by Gargantuars.</color>

plants.name: Spicy Kelp
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Passion is like fire," and Spicy Kelp knows this saying all too well. No amount of water can quench their fervent flames! Too bad, the nearby zombies can only feel the heat of the "grilling". Look at them, they have already turned to ashes in this relentless fire!</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spicy Kelp will burn the entire row of zombies upon contact.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill + 1800 (Cremator)</color></size>

plants.name: Mangle Kelp
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Mangle Kelp stands out as a true philosopher among plants. It often ponders profound questions like, "Where does the grass come from, and where does it go?" However, its disregard for personal hygiene and unkempt hair make other plants shy away, preferring to keep their distance.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Mangle Kelp can drag three zombies into the water.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill×3</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Drags three zombies into the water. Each drag also deals 600 damage to nearby zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Kelp-spreader
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Kelp-spreader basked in the sun, his eyes scanning the horizon. "Many plants are scared of my gaze," he chuckled. "But they'd understand if they had to wear three pairs of sunglasses for protection like I do!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can fire kelps that slow down aquatic zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/1.5</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack adds 1 Tangle value.</color>
<color=#006400>Tangled Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Slows targets and stackable with Chill. Zombies affected receive more and more additional percentage damage from kelps based on the zombie's Tangle Value, until they're insta-killed when the Tangle Value is full (30).</color></size>

plants.name: Infernowood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"It's sweltering out here!" Infernowood fumed. Convinced that the intense weather was to blame for its skin, it noted how the flames on its head had also turned a vibrant red. Maybe it was the perfect time to kick off a summer adventure called the "Sledding Tour."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Infernowood can provide an even stronger damage boost to projectiles!

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Explodes like a Jalapeno upon death.
<color=black>•</color> Ignites projectiles for the following effects:
	-Peas, Potatoes and Low-tier Ignited Peas:
	  +40 damage
	-Frozen Peas: Turn into regular peas
	-Cherries, Bucks, Suns: ×4 damage
	-Queen Endoflame's attacks:
	  Now drop 15 Suns instead of 5.
<color=black>•</color> Deals 40 damage-over-time to nearby zombies every 1.5 seconds.</color></size>

plants.name: Scorchwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>High temperatures and spiciness always go hand in hand. Scorchwood may not grasp this concept, but his years of working at the barbecue stall have certainly infused him with a distinctive heat.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Projectiles ignited by the Scorchwood has greatly increased power.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Explodes like a Jalapeno upon death.
<color=black>•</color> Ignites projectiles for the following effects:
	-Peas, Potatoes and Low-tier Ignited Peas:
	  +30 damage
	-Frozen Peas: Turn into regular peas.</color></size>

plants.name: Spicy Squash
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm not as impatient as my brother," Spicy Squash stated calmly. "He rushes through everything, but I've learned that true success comes from patience and careful observation. Sometimes, it's best to wait and let the fire simmer."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spicy Squash can burn a whole row of zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> 1800 (Single Tile) + 1800 (Lane + Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Releases Jalapeno effect when crushing zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Torchthree
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Why is Torchthree so rich?" the plants frequently pondered. "Oh, it's no big deal," he shrugged. Torchthree then produced three peas from his hair and added, "I used to work as a magician in a circus."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Splits flaming peas into at most 3 lanes.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
Ignites peas:
<color=black>•</color> 1st ignition is exactly like Torchwood;
<color=black>•</color> 2nd ignition splits into two peas on the rows above and below;
<color=black>•</color> 3rd ignition splits into three peas across all three rows;
<color=black>•</color> The cycle repeats.</color></size>

plants.name: Torch-kelp
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Fire struggles to exist beneath the water, which means I can't use my flames to light the way," Torch-kelp admitted. "But once above the surface, my flames can shine once again."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Ignites kelp shots and drags one zombie into the water.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Ignites peas and kelp shots for +20 damage. Ignited kelp shots can add 1 Tangle Value to all zombies in the splash range. Every time 100 shots are lit, a Hot Tangle Kelp will be planted in front.</color></size>

plants.name: Hot Squash
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hot Squashes jumps out from the Squash Torchwood one by one, "It's getting hot in there; our entire body is melting!" they declared.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Just a Squash roasted and glazed with delicious sap.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Cannot be used for fusions.</color></size>

plants.name: Scorched Threepeater
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Why does Jalapeno always get all the credit?" Scorched Threepeater exclaimed, smoke escaping from his mouth. "If they only realized that fusing with Jalapeno burns your peas." He turned to Torchwood with a serious look. "Trust me, you wouldn't want to munch on charred peas!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Threepeater who can't fuse because he's scorched.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×3/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces a line of flames that deal 1800 (Cremator) damage in three lanes when planted or fused.</color></size>

plants.name: Squashed Torchwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"It's way too hot! Too hot!" Squash yelled, trapped in the flames of Torchwood. "Who put me here? I should be squashing zombies, not being the punchline at a barbecue party!" The heat was overwhelming, and as he reached his breaking point, he ignited, bursting forth from the torch to rejoin the battle against the zombies.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces a Squash in front for each 60 peas that pass through it.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Every time 60 peas are lit, a Squash will be planted in front.</color></size>

plants.name: Spikerock
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spikerock just got back from a trip to Europe. He had a great time, met some wonderful people, really broadened his horizons. He never knew they made museums so big, or put so many paintings in them. That was a big surprise for him.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spikerocks pop multiple tires and hurt any zombies that step on them.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/1 Second</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>450</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Can puncture tires, but deducts 50 Toughness. Loses 50 Toughness when slammed on by Gargantuars and loses 150 when stomped on by Mech Gargs.</color></size>

plants.name: Torchweed
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm Torchweed, the zombies' passionate barbecue chef! Ignite that little pea, and I'll throw them an unforgettable barbecue party. Rest assured, I'm a professional—I guarantee it will be crispy on the outside and tender on the inside!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Torchweed can ignite small peas and puncture vehicles.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1 Second</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Ignite small peas for increased, and splashed, damage.
<color=black>•</color> Every time 100 small peas are lit, a Hot Spikeweed will be planted in front.
<color=black>•</color> Can also pop the balloons of regular Balloon Zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Scorchweed
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Studies reveal that spiciness is actually a type of pain," Scorchweed announced, rattling the red thorns on his head. "I intend to let the unbelieving zombies experience this reality for themselves."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Scorchweed pops tires and enflames zombies that step on them.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1 Second</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks inflict Enflamed Debuff.</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000> Damage taken increases by 50%; zombies with this debuff explode on death, spreading it further.</color></size>

plants.name: Squashweed
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Huh? Yeah." This catchphrase belongs to Squashweed, who rarely speaks and often leaves others feeling uncertain. After dinner, the topic of thorns always becomes a favorite among the plants. It's said that on an ordinary afternoon, as Squash prepared to crush a nearby zombie, he overlooked the thorns lurking beneath its feet.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Zombies will be knocked back every time it attacks.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack will knock back zombies and fire 1 bouncing mini-squash.</color></size>

plants.name: Weed-spreader
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Weed-spreader rose to fame on Tumbler with his viral posts on weeding techniques, but when fans tried them near their lawnmowers, jammed engines and smoking hoods ensued. "Effective, not vehicle-safe," he shrugged.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires 3 weeds that deal enhanced damage to vehicles.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>5×3/1.5 Seconds (Piercing)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Weeds deal 30% maximum Toughness damage to vehicles at the cost of themselves.</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Pea-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"We're off to join the army!" the three little mushrooms shouted with joy. Although their heights didn't meet the requirements and locating small helmets was a struggle, these challenges couldn't hold back the Gatling Pea-shrooms. United as one, they set their sights on becoming the top trio in the army.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can be stacked three times to shoot 12 small peas at once!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×4/2.25 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Krakerberus
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Krakerberus possesses a contemplative heart. If you hand him a glass of root beer, be prepared for a discourse on Nietzsche's or Kant's works.Although he has profound musings, sometimes he longs for lighthearted conversations.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires kelp that bounce upon contact and slow down water zombies, can also drag 3 zombies under the water.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×3/3 Seconds</color>
<color=#006400>Tangled Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Kelp bounce upon contact, dealing 40 Damage to nearby zombies when they land. Adds 1 Tangle Value upon contact.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Can drag 3 zombies under the water.</color></size>

plants.name: Cattail
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Woof!" says Cattail. "Woof woof woof! Does this confuse you? Do you expect me to say 'Meow' like a cat because the word 'cat' is in my name and I also look like a cat? That's not how things work around here. I refuse to be pigeonholed."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cattails can attack any lane and shoot down balloon zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Frost Cattail
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I'm not just a cat... I'm... I'm a super blue cat!" declared Frost Cattail. "Do you have some cold catnip...?" His love for catnip shines through, and he has an undeniable fascination with all things cool.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Frost Cattail can attack any zombie in the lane and deal extra damage to chilled targets.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×2/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals ×2 damage to chilled zombies. Deals ×4 damage to frozen zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Flame Cattail
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"When I was young, I thought I'd be a regular Cattail," Flame Cattail said, warming her tail with pride. "Turns out, I'm a blazing inferno of awesomeness!" Frost Cattail sighed from the corner, muttering, "Showoff."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Flame Cattail can attack zombies in any lane and deal high damage.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×2/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals ×3 damage to Enflamed zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Gloom-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I've always enjoyed releasing heavy fumes," says Gloom Shroom. "I know a lot of people aren't cool with that. They say it's rude or that it smells bad. All I can say is, would you rather have your brain eaten by zombies?"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gloom-shrooms fire heavy fumes in an area around them.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×4/1.9 Seconds (Piercing)</color></size>

plants.name: Embergloom-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Embergloom-shroom's ability to release hot steam has established him as a celebrated pastry baker. His signature spicy pastries are a favorite among many, cherished for their distinct flavors.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Releases high-damaging ember fumes around it.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×4/1.9 Seconds (Piercing)</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Inflicts the Enflamed debuff when attacking zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Snowgloom-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Dreaming of a career as a physicist, the Snowgloom-shroom dedicates his days to unraveling the complexities of the world, avoiding contact with other plants. "Why do I have multiple strings of ice cones sprouting from my head?" he muses, the latest question occupying his thoughts. He's oddly adamant about calling them "strings."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Releases cold fumes around that can freeze zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×4/1.9 Seconds (Piercing)</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack adds 5 Cryo points.</color></size>

plants.name: Scorch Tall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Scorch Tall-nut is a huge fan of the Olympics and passionately insists that Torchwood be chosen as the Olympic torch. Cautious warning to the uninformed though: do not try to eat him. You may find yourself burning up from the spicy heat.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Zombies will get enflamed when it is bitten.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>When affected by the Jalapeno, heals 3000 Toughness. Inflicts Enflamed debuff and deals 20 damage to zombies that bite him.</color></size>

plants.name: Spikecicle
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After his return from Alaska, Spikecicle couldn't contain his excitement. Eager to freeze the zombies solid, he relished the thought of "ice" bursting beneath their feet. He made it a point that everyone use the term "ice." His skin still carried the chill from his Arctic adventure, and his eyes shimmered with the brilliance of unmelting snow.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can puncture tires and freeze zombies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>450</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×2/1 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks inflict Chill and add 5 Cryo points.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits traits from Spikerock.</color></size>

plants.name: Spikinferno
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Not long ago, Spikinferno traveled to Mexico and was swept away by the vibrant enthusiasm of the locals, quickly falling in love with tacos. Now, he's pouring all his energy into a taco museum alongside Spikecicle, though Spikecicle doesn't seem to share his enthusiasm.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Enflame zombies that step on it and also puncture vehicles.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>450</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×2/1 Seconds</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Applies the Enflamed Debuff when attacking zombies.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits traits from Spikerock.</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Thorn-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"People often ask about my appearance, so let me clarify: I'm from the Namib Desert," Sea Thorn-shroom said to anyone who inquired. "If you're familiar with geography, you'll know that a desert can be found right next to the ocean!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attack flying zombies and airships, growing in size after a while.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20 → 20×4/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>120 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant.</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Sun-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Sadly, I am a mushroom, not a flower, so I can't be called a sea flower or anything similar," Sea Sun-shroom admitted. "At times, this brings me down, but don't let it bother you. I may not be a sunflower, yet I can still use different physical and chemical reactions in the water to bring you sunshine!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces increasing amounts of Sun as it grows.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>15 → 25 → 50/15 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>20 Seconds → 40 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant.</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Lamp-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I've been a light system at a pirate pool party, worked for an Amazon deep-water salvage company for three months, and even served as night fishing bait while I was sleeping!" Sea Lamp-shroom shared, a mix of anger and pride evident in his voice. "Now, I'm looking for a stable job. Uncle Dave mentioned that the backyard pool needed lighting, but he forgot to mention it was infested with zombies!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Dispels fog and give light, growing in size after a while.

<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>60 Seconds</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Gives 1 Lumos Level to a 3×3 area, then 5×5 after growth.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant. Inherits traits from Plantern.</color></size>

plants.name: Lumos Cactus
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"My adventures in the desert have made me remarkably brilliant," Lumos Cactus boasted, but he never forgot to replenish his lamp oil each day to ensure he continued to shine.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires piercing spikes and lasers, depending on the Lumos level.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Gets the following buffs depending on the Lumos Level:
<color=black>•</color> Level 1 = Pierce 2 Times
<color=black>•</color> Level 2 = Infinite Pierce Laser, Air Damage ×3
<color=black>•</color> Level 3 = Base Laser Damage → 40</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Shoots 2 times at once when attacking flying zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Glowver
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The silver candle illuminates the cold autumn canvas, while the light silk fan dances gracefully with the fireflies." This is Glowver's beloved poem. His fascination with fireflies began in childhood, and he often enjoys the cool breeze by the water at night, admiring how their fluorescence rises gently from the wind, twinkling before softly falling back into the dark grass. Only zombies would overlook such exquisite beauty.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Dispels fog and increases the Lumos level of Lumos plants present.

<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Gives 1 Lumos Level for Lumos plants in the entire field for 30 seconds.</color></size>

plants.name: Starglow
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Stars dance on the water as fishing lights prepare to rise into the sky. The waves carry away the moon while the tide brings forth the stars. As a child, Starglow dreamed of picking the stars, often gazing at their shimmer on the water. Meeting Plantern taught her that one need not envy the brilliant stars above; even the faintest light, like fireflies, has its own warmth and beauty.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots stars that can track zombies if there's light.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60×5/3 Seconds</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Gets the following buffs: 
<color=black>•</color> Level 1 = Stars can now track zombies in the same row.
<color=black>•</color> Level 2 = Stars are fired continuously regardless of zombies.
<color=black>•</color> Level 3 = Stars track zombies everywhere.</color></size>

plants.name: Cactus Drone
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cactus Drones always move in groups, chirping arrogantly and looking down on others. The other plants are curious what such tiny creatures could possibly do, but the Cactus Drones remain unfazed: "If butterflies can stir up a storm, then of course we're far more powerful."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spits out thorns to attack zombies in the sky. Does not occupy any grid.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30×2/1.5 seconds (Stationary), 30×2/1 Second (Wingman)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Hovering plant. Can be planted on top of another plant.</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Star
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Though my name resembles that of an animal, it's just a stage name," Sea Star explained. "I'm a magician who can expel spores of various shapes." He harbors a deep dislike for diving zombies, worried they'll uncover the truth: he's simply a sea-shroom with a star-shaped water gun perched on his head.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attacks twice when fully grown.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×5 → 20×5×2/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>60 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Starblover
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Gather the stars around me and give them to those wishing upon a shooting star," Starblover proudly declares, believing it to be a noble mission. However, not everyone appreciates it—especially when the star shower comes flying directly at them.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attracts stars to rotate around itself and launch them out.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attracts nearby star projectiles. After 1.5 seconds, shoots them out as tracking projectiles with twice the speed. If the projectiles already have tracking abilities before the acceleration, their damage is increased by 50% instead. Attracts up to 20 stars maximum.</color></size>

plants.name: Starthorn
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Starthorn has always been a bit of an oddity. The plants joke, "He's always on the ground but only fights the flying zombies. Why doesn't he go after the ground ones?" Starthorn, ever patient, says nothing, quietly protecting his secret: his poor vision only allows him to see the sky when he lies down.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can only attack zombies in the sky.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×5/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Thorny stars track flying zombies across the board.</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Blow-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sea Blow-shroom has aspirations as grand as a dragon's. Mastering the ancient art of "Feng Shui" from the East, he is well aware of both lucky and unlucky positions. Understanding that wind and water complement each other, he hopes to keep misfortune at bay, whether soaring in the sky or gliding through the water.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Dispels fog and blows back zombies in the water.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Dispels fog and push the zombies in his lane to the rightmost column.</color></size>

plants.name: Jack O' Lantern
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Jack O' Lantern insists that he frequently encounters ghosts, but do they truly exist? Who can say for certain? Perhaps he was simply dragged into another round of Halloween festivities by someone eager for a good scare.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>In a small area, dispels fog and increase the Lumos Level for the Lumos plants inside.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Give 1 Lumos Level in a 3×3 Grid. Restores 150 Toughness per Lumos Level every 15 seconds.</color></size>

plants.name: Thorny Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Thorny Pumpkin might look like a distant relative of Pumpkin, but its current form comes from a desert adventure with Blover. Strangely enough, it doesn't seem to have visible thorns, yet plants that try to hop into it always get poked, leaving them questioning how it happens.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Counterattacks the zombies that bite it.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Reflect 100% of biting damage back to zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Starry Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>People often wonder how many languages Starry Pumpkin must know to communicate effortlessly with all the plants. Starry Pumpkin smiles and says, "Actually, I only speak Starfruit's language, since he's the only one I work closely with."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Helps Starblover retain more stars.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Increases the storage limit of Starblover to 80, and Gravitron to 240.</color></size>

plants.name: Split Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Split Pea brothers always argued over the best direction to fire—forward or backward. But now they've found a clever solution: just let the peas rebound. Problem solved!</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Split Peas shoot peas forward and backwards.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×3/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Peas shot backwards will rebound upon reaching the edge of the screen.</color></size>

plants.name: Windy Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>For Windy Pumpkin, looking good is a top priority. He never leaves home without first spending a solid half hour perfecting the leaves on his head, ensuring his style is flawless.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Every so often a Blover will spawn to blow away the fog.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces a Blover every 30 seconds.</color></size>

plants.name: Pumpkin Lure
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Dining out sends shivers down Pumpkin Lure's spine. He's always fearful that the iron cutlery will magically stick to his face, turning an enjoyable meal into an awkward experience.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can fuse with iron materials from zombies to absorb their properties.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
